updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans!

We're back again to keep you up to speed on the latest Hero Forge news and Kickstarter developments. With only about a dozen stretch goals remaining, we wanted to pull back the curtain a bit and give some insight into what to look forward to and what's next! Enjoy this infographic and a video update from our CEO, Teagan Morrison.

updates.update_userinfo: 'Mud and Blood' Decals and a New Beta Feature!
updates.update_content:
Hello Hero Forge Fans! 
We’re constantly amazed by the creativity with which this amazing community approaches each new feature, achieving all kinds of inventive looks, effects, and characters that we'd never imagined possible when we first launched Hero Forge. To that end, we're excited to announce two cool new features, including a highly anticipated stretch goal and a new experimental option for our full color miniature prints. Read on for more info!

Hello there, Hero Forge Fans!
We hope the new year finds you well. We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest Kickstarter news and content additions. Since our last backer update, we’ve launched three more exciting stretch goals: “Light Emanating Surface Effects,” “Expanded Hand Items as Side Items with Posing,” and “Banners!” These new features are available to all Kickstarter backers through their beta access privileges and, as always, we welcome your feedback. Drop by our official color feature feedback survey ()and let us know what you think.

Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!
We’re back again with a very merry backer update! Read on to learn about how Hero Forge celebrates the season and find out about special Kickstarter content releases for the holidays.
Adventure Calendar

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Update - 3D Virtual Tabletop Models and More Stretch Goals
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!

We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest stretch goal progress, new content releases, and to announce an exciting new Hero Forge® product option! Read on for the latest news.

3D Virtual Tabletop Downloads (Compatible with Berserk Games’ Tabletop Simulator)

Ever since we teased the addition of color, we’ve had tons of folks ask about full-color download options for their favorite 3D virtual tabletop applications. Well, we have some good news! We’re thrilled to announce a brand new way to use Hero Forge: for gamers who play online using Berserk Games’ , we now offer a full color “3D Tabletop Download” option!

3D Tabletop Downloads are distributed in .unity3d format. This single-file format makes importing easy and provides superb faithfulness to your original design. 3D Tabletop Downloads are distributed via your user profile page, just like STL downloads, and we offer a free pre-made sample model which is available on your Digital Downloads page . Instructions for importing these models can be found in our support page . Please note that this is a beta feature which will only be visible for users with beta access--a ”public” release date is TBD.

Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!
We’re continuing to hustle on stretch goals and are happy to report that we’ve added several new batches over the last couple of weeks!

New Arm Options
We’ve recently added a wide range of design tools to customize your character’s arms. Hero Forge® now supports four or six armed characters, and arm amputation options including shoulder disarticulation, transhumeral amputation, and transradial amputation. We also added a range of wraps and prosthetic choices for artificial limbs in both realistic and fantastical varieties, including the oft-requested pirate hook hand.

On top of that, we’ve also added the stretch goal for a brand new slider: arm length! This will allow you to stretch your character’s arms to longer, less human proportions.

updates.update_userinfo: The First Batch of Stretch Goal Decals Has Arrived: Hair Ombrés!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans
We're excited to announce that we've arrived at another 'first.' Our first set of decals is now available to Kickstarter backers! As a reminder, decals are additional color-customizable graphic elements that overlay existing parts and colors, adding a whole new layer of flexibility. They also represent one of the most labor-intensive additions to our new color tools, and account for a whopping 14 of our unlocked stretch goals.

updates.update_userinfo: Hero Forge Reddit AMA begins tomorrow at 11:00am PST!
updates.update_content: We will be hosting a reddit AMA on https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/ tomorrow at 11:00am PST. We’ll be answering questions about Hero Forge 2.0, 3D printed tabletop miniatures, and more. Feel free to drop by!

Greetings, Hero Forge Fans

We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest Hero Forge news. Today is a big one, so read on for exciting updates!

Hero Forge 2.0 Released with New Content
After six months of tireless work, we’re excited to announce that Hero Forge 2.0 with color tools has been released publicly! The first thing you’ll notice is a new, more colorful restyling of our background and menus. We wanted to create a more epic environment for your creativity, and a space where color felt at home, so this aesthetic change felt like a natural evolution from our old grayscale background and menu. This also includes some minor, but long-overdue reorganizations, such as moving expression and eye direction into the “pose” menu.

We also wanted this update to be accompanied by ! Keen eyes will spot the arrival of a several exciting features:

updates.update_userinfo: Public Release for Hero Forge 2.0, “Hero Forge Pro” Subscription News, and More!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans,
We’re back again to keep you posted on the latest and greatest Hero Forge news. Read on for important backer information!

Public Release of Hero Forge 2.0 Color Tools
Over the past six months, you've put our color tools beta through its paces, provided us with fantastic feedback, and created some of the most colorful characters we have ever seen! Now that a significant percentage of Kickstarter backers have redeemed their rewards and a multitude of bugs have been slain, we are excited to launch color tools to the public. At long last, we’re ready to announce an official date, and we’re happy to say it is right around the corner! You heard it here first, folks: This transition will also mark the arrival of some neat new features, including restyling our character creator UI with color in mind!

PD GIF
Thanks to our incredible backers, our prior Kickstarter projects have been amazing successes have and allowed us to introduce hundreds of fantastic gaming miniatures into our Bones Classic and the new Bones Black ranges.
Bones V promises to offer you more! More Monsters! More Dragons! More Characters! More variety and more amazing new models!
By backing Bones V you can help expand our Bones Classic and Bones Black miniatures lines. Your support makes the molds that we need to produce the figures; the more backers we get the more molds we can produce, which means we can make more miniatures! As a backer you will get to take your pick of these amazing figures for a fantastic backer-only bargain deal! 
 The Bones 5 Core Set is the cornerstone of our Kickstarter! It's an exceptional value, with over 100 miniatures and the box grows along with the success of the Kickstarter! You won't find a bigger bang for your buck! Check out the image below to see what your $120 pledge gets you when you select the Core Set as one of your rewards!
Want to add more minis?
Simply add more to your pledge. Remember the more you pledge the more minis you can choose. The more you pledge, the more minis and rewards will be unlocked!
Need some help? Go to the Reaper Pledge Manager to see how much you should add. You can always add more to your pledge later, but only money added right now during Kickstarter will count towards unlocking future stretch goals!
 We've taken the Core Set and broken it into smaller chunks, so if you want a specific miniature you can just add the amount shown to your pledge and select it as a reward in the Reaper Pledge Manager. Need more Catfolk? Just add $6 to your pledge! This is a great way to get more of your favorite minis from the Core Set!
Options are miniatures that aren't part of the Core Set, but can be added to your pledge. Just add the amount shown and select your reward in the Reaper Pledge Manager!
Expansion Sets are like smaller, themed Core Sets. They usually contain three unlocks before being completed. Take a look at these Expansions and the fantastic miniatures in each one!




All Official Updates will be posted via the Kickstarter Updates section of Bones 5 Escape from Pizza Dungeon! 
 Stay up with the latest news and updates here on Kickstarter and on our Social Media outlets!    
It’s that time!
Thanks to our incredible backers, our prior Kickstarter projects have been amazing successes! We’ve added hundreds of models to both the Bones Classic and the new Bones Black ranges.
We’ve also heard that you want more! More Monsters! More Dragons! More Characters! More variety and more amazing new models!

                                                                  You're in luck! We’ve spent the last two years creating a large batch of more Bones sweetness.
Since Bones are still really expensive to produce, and we again need your help to expand our Bones Classic and Bones Black miniatures lines. Your support makes the molds that we need to produce the figures, and in exchange you get the first crack at these figures for a fantastic backer-only deal!
So what’s this all about?

                                                                  It’s about Bones miniature figurines, which are the best high-quality plastic gaming models to hit the industry in the last decade. Inexpensive, highly detailed gaming models that are easy and fun to paint and won't break when you actually use them for games!
What are all the models and maps above?
Below are all of the models contained in the initial Core Set.
After we reach our initial funding goal, we'll keep going and the contents of the initial Core Set will keep on growing. How large will the Core Set get you ask? Well that’s top secret at Reaper but based on prior Kickstarters it’s safe to say it should go past 140 miniatures~
The map tracks our progress. Each stop along the way unlocks more fun!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

!! VERY IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ !! 

PRODUCTION AND FULFILLMENT

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories:
1) Overall Non-completion.
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates.
3) We do not produce a specific model or change/subtract or add a piece to a specific model.
4) The bulk of our Kickstarter will be made in China. A tariff in excess of 50% or a ban on Chinese imports would seriously delay delivery and/or, in a worse case, shutdown this project entirely. If such an event occurs early on in this project, refunds (less charges and expense payments made) might be possible. If it occurs later in this project (after almost all expenses have been paid) there would be little and possibly no refunds. 

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed several massive Kickstarters and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of this Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment against loss or damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We have learned a lot from our Kickstarters. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that helps us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays, like ones we have control or exercise input over, are easy to solve. Other delays that are out of our control, such as US Customs and Border Protection and Consumer Product Safety Commission inspections and dock yard labor strikes are examples of delays out of our control. In the end we do everything possible to avoid any delay and will always update you as soon as possible.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in a specific model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for to back it verses the cost to produce it. This event has never occurred in any of our previous Kickstarters, but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops you will have plenty of time to adjust your Pledge Manager.

Also we reserve the right to modify any model or piece of a model shown to meet cost and production requirements. Modifications may include the removal or addition of new parts to a model. 

REFUND POLICY

If it is within 14 days of the closing of this Kickstarter we will refund your entire pledge amount. After 14 days, but before the closing of this Kickstarter’s Reaper Pledge Manager, we will refund your entire pledge minus the 10% Kickstarter and Processing Fees we incur. Once the Reaper Pledge Manager closes, refund requests are subject to review and not all requests may be honored.

YOUR BACKER RESPONSIBILITY IN THIS KICKSTARTER

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge in the Reaper Pledge Manager by August 31, 2020 you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after August 31, 2020.

Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics. If you confirm your pledge late (after April 30, 2021) some items may not still be available. This means that part, if not all, of your rewards may not be available and/or your pledge may be forfeit.

You are responsible for all fees associated with the transit and acceptance by you to complete delivery. These include, but are not limited to: import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant and taxing authorities, VAT and GST due and delivery acceptance, brokerage and collection charges.

You are required to provide correct address information and ensure this address is deliverable by normal methods before your rewards are shipped.

You must have your address correct and up to date in the Reaper Pledge Manager when we announce shipping is beginning. You may change it at any time until then. There may be a shipping surcharge associated with changing countries.

Rewards returned to us as undeliverable will be shipped again postage prepaid by the Backer.

ALL OFFICIAL COMMUNICATIONS FOR THIS KICKSTARTER WILL BE VIA KICKSTARTER UPDATES ONLY.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
Despite that we are still waiting on two of our last containers here at our US warehouse, we have decided to announce a start date for USA/North America/South American shipping.
Starting Monday, June 28, we will begin shipping Bones 5 orders.

Happy Saturday!
This is an unscheduled update regarding our last remaining containers. 

USA Hub: We're still waiting on our last two containers to arrive at our warehouse. The good news is that one of them is in the DFW area and is awaiting CBP and CPSC inspection. As soon as that's done, we could have the container here at any time. Please note that we have had inspections take one day, and we've had inspections take 3 weeks. We are hoping that it will be days rather than weeks.  Our second container is still in Long  Beach and has not been sent by rail to DFW yet.  We will continue to monitor and keep everyone informed of the status.

updates.update_userinfo: Light at the End of the Tunnel
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
Not a whole lot of hard information, but a few nuggets to get us through the weekend.
Boat Plugs: turns out they're not necessary
USA Shipping: We're targeting the week of June 14th to start shipping. We call this a "soft" date.

updates.update_userinfo: The Waiting Continues and Ship Update
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
Unfortunately, this update doesn't come with any relevant news regarding the start of fulfillment.
We're still waiting for containers to arrive here in the USA, UK, and Australia. 
We cannot begin fulfillment until all products arrive and are accounted for.

Hey Backers!
Not a lot of big news in the last two weeks, but a few small developments.
We're still waiting for the last container to arrive containing Ghost Pirate Ships and the remaining Options. We received the supplies for the Bones 5 Learn to Paint Kit and our team has already assembled all of these.

Hey Backers!
Not a lot of big news in the last two weeks, but a few small developments.
Three more containers arrived this past week, two of which contained most of the Pirate Ship models for USA fulfillment. This thing is HUGE and you guys are going to love it!
The third container was filled with various Options from Bones 5, including Aganzarax, Valfuryx, the War Mammoth, and most of the Extras from the Core Set.

Hello Backers!
Thanks for hanging in there while your Kickstarter rewards wind their way into your hands!
UK/EU Shipping

Hi Backers!
First, apologies for missing the last scheduled update. We got wrapped up in our Reaper Virtual Expo and we simply missed it. We will try to do better!
Peeking Behind the Curtain

Hi Backers,
Apologies, but very little info this update as well. With a historic wave of bad weather sweeping through Texas last week and yours truly contracting Covid, there's not much to report.  

However, the first containers are on the water and are scheduled to arrive on the west coast next week. If all goes well, we should have containers arriving at our warehouse at the beginning of March! More containers are expected to ship at the end of February after CNY.

updates.update_userinfo: Container Shipments Underway to our USA Warehouse
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
Much like our last update, this week has not much to report. 
Our manufacturing partners overseas have shipped several containers before the Chinese New Year holiday beginning next week. 
This is great news, as it allows us to start the organization and planning phase of fulfillment as we await the remaining containers that will ship following the end of CNY later in February.

campaign.story:
Beholden to the gods of dice and dungeons, Eldritch Foundry brings miniatures from the far reaches of the outer planes. But not any miniatures. Our expert team of Gnome Wizards work tirelessly to bring the most customizable and powerful figures for your character. Our sleek, seamless, flash-less miniatures are unrivaled in appearance and each is blessed by a team of Clerics. 
    Can’t find the perfect miniature for your Dwarven Fighter?  
Eldritch Foundry.
    Are the only miniatures available carrying a broadsword instead of a warhammer? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Is the figure’s beard too short for your perfect avatar? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Through dark and forbidden rituals, we have given you, the player, the ability to select everything about your character. Complete customization is now in the hands of the player. Whatever hands, head, tail, wings, clothes, weapons, and practically anything else you can think of, we can do. Even the most mundane of coin purses will look amazing on your character – through our high-quality 3D printing.  
 This project combines everything you want from a miniature - the original creative art, with the best quality that can be found for a customized unique printed miniatures.
*Warning: Miniatures may contain bonus Experience Points 
     The Eldritch Foundry has partnered with the leading US 3D printer manufacturer, 3DSystems, and our in-house printers utilize the most advanced technology available on the market. As such, we are printing at a quality that is substantially higher than anyone else. We print at about 40% higher definition than anyone else on the market.
Most miniatures currently available on the market are printed at around 50 microns. An Eldritch Foundry miniature is printed at around 32 microns. In addition, we use wax supports. This process means your miniatures will have no flash, no mold lines, and no seams. 
       Our character creator interface is like nothing you’ve seen before, except perhaps in video games. We have developed a one-of-a-kind character creator to a look and feel that closely resembles the character creators in Baldur’s Gate, Planescape, Torment, or even Skyrim (well, at least the starting bit). The interface is intuitive and easy to use, while providing for a maximum level of customization for your miniature.
    Each and every character choice, from race and class, to armor and weapons, has a unique lore associated with it. We have partnered with several brilliant writers (most notably- the amazing Patrick Stuart!) to create a lore that is as unique as our character creator. 
    This process, from the unique character creator to the expansive and in-depth lore,  makes creating a high quality and custom miniature more immersive and helps create a world-building experience.
       We have developed the first and only conditional marker base for your miniatures. This base allows for the quick and easy identification of conditional statuses of your character, without the need for conditional rings or milk jug rings. The conditions available on your unique Eldritch Foundry miniature base include poisoned, restrained, concentration, deafened, petrified, grappled, blinded, and frightened. We have even provided conditional marker bases that are blank, if you prefer to draw your own. We’ll even have an option where you can choose which conditions you want on your base (but that’s a bit more down the line).
      In order to bring you the finest quality miniatures, every piece is first individually drawn by gentle hands of our Tiefling concept artists. Then, these sketches are animated, given sentience, and turned into 3-dimensional models.  Our miniatures are then crafted from these models by an expert team of Gnome Wizards. This process is designed to bring you the highest-quality, unique, and magically enchanted miniatures possible. 
      To bring you more, we must first provide offerings to the lords of darkness and miniatures, who enslave hapless concept artists for no less than 99 years. These concept artists provide us with all the exquisite art, in order to bring the most realistic and beautifully rendered miniatures to you, the player.  Through this project we intend to bring you more items, races, mounts, perhaps a campaign setting, and even a little thing we think of as "the bits box".
       The Eldritch Foundry's founders are gamers, like you. We would like to let gamers take their character from the imaginary and make them a reality. To provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of the model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing quality available. More than that, table-top gaming is a community experience. As such, we provide services both with online sales and through friendly local gaming stores.  
Enjoyable and intuitive site - for the quick and easy customization of your characters.
Unique and original craftsmanship -of all the items, armor, weapons, clothes, and accessories your character will ever need.
Built-in status indicator bases - for quick and easy identification of character status' 
New origin lore written for Eldritch Foundry - making the character creation process much more immersive and interesting. 
Quality 3D printing - showing the finest detail available on the market, exactly as designed by you, the player.
      The Eldritch Foundry, a group of nerds and geeks dedicated to bringing the most unique and customizable miniatures available. We are committed to improving your games. And we are enthusiastic about our mission.
The Eldritch Foundry loves the TTRPG community- and acts on it with a business model that is geared towards helping your local gaming store thrive. We incentivize foot traffic by offering free shipping if you send your avatar to your local gaming store. We share in every miniature sale made within store grounds, and for every miniature sent to stores.
Retailers- feel free to reach out, we'd love to discuss this in person!
Our partner FLGS, Knight's Watch Games:
  "Eldritch Foundry is a revolutionary company that bridges the gap between producers, retailers and customers.  The ability for a customer to design, purchase and pick-up their customized miniature at the brick and mortar store facilitates better relationships between buyer and seller, guarantees a better shopping experience, and higher customer satisfaction. The immersive process of personalizing a character and reading the powerful descriptions for the various options makes building your dream character super entertaining!" - Brenda and Paraic Mulgrew of Knight's Watch Games
The Eldritch Foundry is a firm believer that the TTRPG community is just that- a community. We strive to work with everybody- from stores, to local artists, to gaming streams, and beyond. As such, we've begun partnering with the D4 D&D stream (go check them out!) to provide their gaming miniatures.
We've also started working with artists from the community which we love- first and foremost- the Griffon's Saddlebag (you can see his Retaliating Shield on some of our minis, even!).
      Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes, based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all.
US shipping (to your local gaming store)- FREE!
Rest of the world - shipping will cost $10.
 What is the Eldritch Foundry?
      We are two friends, who quit our day jobs, and founded Eldritch Foundry. We provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of your miniature’s model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing technology available. This process will give your miniatures a sleek, seamless, flash-less appearance not available in any other product on the market.
How do the miniature coupons work?
      All rewards for “custom miniature coupon(s)” are presented as coupons, and as such, are good indefinitely. This allows you to redeem at any point and even for future releases and features.  
When will the Miniatures Ship?
      Tricky question! Our full Character Foundry will be up and running August 1st, when we debut at Gen Con. We are currently gunning for a weeks turnaround (1-2 days to print, 3-6 days of shipping in the US), but a two week turnaround is a bit more likely (especially if we have a huge backlog). 
It should be noted that we will be adding more and more items, races, weapons and… stuff(?) as time progress, so if you have a specific idea for your mini, look up our development schedule on our site!
What about international shipping?
      Shipping to the US is free of charge. Shipping to Western Europe is going to add about 10$ on top of your pledge level.
How do I select more than one pledge goal?
     In Kickstarter you can only really select one pledge goal, but no worries. If none of the pledge levels are just right, pick the one closest to what you want, and you can adjust upwards later in our backer kit. 
Retailers - What are the typical cost of an Eldritch Foundry miniature in a retail store?
      Our current pricing point for a single miniature is about MSRP 35$. The conditional marker base should add another 10$ on top of that. Oversized models will run you about 10$ extra. 
We’re still looking into “bits” pricing and quantities, so that’s a big WIP right now.
     New to Kickstarter? No problem! Just follow these simple steps: 
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) Development challenges

 We have been accepted as exhibitors at Gen Con 2019. As such, we have a hard deadline to have our character creator site up and running by August 2019. With this in mind, our current plan is to launch as soon as possible, with various additional features being introduced later on in the development phase. These additional features, which are being considered non-essential for initial launch, are thus marked down as a phase 2. For example, these additional features consist of features like “bits” purchasing and social media sharing with cool filters are lower on our priority list.
 In all regards, development of the product is largely complete with high-quality highly detailed miniatures. This project is intended to raise capital in financially reasonable way.


2) Asset creation:

 Our asset creation timeline is very much dependent on how successful the Kickstarter campaign is. Our current funding is enough to let us reach Gen Con 2019 with an already assembled asset library of high Fantasy weapon and armor sets, and the base races of Humans, Elves (& half-Elves), Dwarves, Goliaths and Halflings.
 The greater our success, the faster we hope to add additional assets and features to the system. However, there is an upper limit to how fast we can add additional assets, while still maintaining a high-quality of production. We will have a production schedule posted on our home website once we see how far ahead, we are. This will allow Eldritch Foundry fans to come and see new products and plan ahead for when their favorite race and genres come online.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Dust Wardens: A Queer RPG of Community and Connection in a Haunted Roadside Apocalypse
Art from the Dust Wardens cover by Anna Landin
What is Dust Wardens?
At its core, Dust Wardens is about bonds. It's about polyamory and queer families and safe havens in a world that wants to hurt us. It's about seeing problems that others refuse to solve and taking the matters into our own hands. In this game, we will take on the role of the titular Dust Wardens, people bound together by a force called Limerence which allows us to draw upon potent magical powers.
How does it play?
Dust Wardens has a similar structure to powered by the apocalypse games, with the caveat that there are no playbooks, and it uses a tarot deck instead of dice.
Characters in Dust Wardens have four stats:
Guts measures your forcefulness and how comfortable you are enacting your will on others.

Glamour measures your dramaturgy and how comfortable you are putting yourself on display for others to see.
Guile measures your cunning and how comfortable you are manipulating others.

Give measures your tenderness and how comfortable you are acknowledging other people's struggles.
When you do something that corresponds to one of the Basic Actions or would be cause for a moment of tension, you draw a number of cards equal to the stat that most closely aligns with the action being taken. The outcome of your action is determined by the value of the highest card drawn:
2-5: You suffer a major setback and don’t accomplish your goal.
6-10: You succeed at a cost or face a difficult choice.
Face: You succeed, gaining exactly the outcome you wanted.
Ace cards and Major Arcana cards are special cases:
Aces: You succeed, and activate a special ability based on the Ace drawn.
Major Arcana: When you draw a Major Arcana, something weird and magical happens. Additionally, if the card is upright, treat it as a face. If it's reversed, consider it a 2. Interpret the card as a group, and decide on its consequence together.
Additionally, you'll swear Vows to each other at character creation. These inform your party dynamics, and are also a crucial part of creating your Coven together. Your magic is powered by love and trust, so upsetting the balance between members of your Coven may have dire consequences! On the other hand, if you work together and hold each other in your hearts, even miracles are possible...
So what's the money for?
Dust Wardens is, essentially, complete. It's currently on its seventh revision, and is awaiting contractor writing, some layout work, and a cover. Primarily, the money from this Kickstarter will be for paying for that labor, as well as ordering and shipping physical copies of the game.
$750: kickstarter fees and "just in case" money
$250: self compensation
$1500: budget for contractor writing and layout
$1000: producing and shipping the Zine Edition through Strikethrough Press
$2000: producing and shipping  the Book Edition
All money beyond that which is needed to pay for contractors and fulfilment will go to myself, because I need to pay rent.
What are your rates?
All contractor writing and layout will be compensated at a rate of 40 cents per word.
Stretch Goals
For every $1,500 beyond the goal, all contractor rates increase by ten cents a word.
Who's on the team?
My name is Nora Blake (she/her & zi/zin), and I'm a podcaster and game designer and one half of Happy Rebel Tapestries! I have been working on Dust Wardens for just shy of two years now, and I'm very excited to bring it to the public eye! 
Here are some examples of my work!
 Facade, a Sparked by Resistance RPG about vampires and the pressures they live under in a society that marginalizes and exoticizes them
 Seeds of Rebellion, an anti-fascist RPG of emotion and memory magic
 Delver by Happy Rebel Tapestries, a surrealist dreamscape RPG of meaning-making and dungeon crawling
I've also contributed to a number of RPG Kickstarters in the past, including:
The Hunted playbook from Interstitial: Our Hearts Intertwined by Riley Hopkins
The Zalmoxis playset from Thirteen Demon Princes by Taylor LaBresh
The Fallen playbook from Exodus by Erika Shepherd
I'm also joined by a number of fantastic contractors!!
Natalie the Knife (she/her) is a tremendous designer with an eye for delicate and specific writing. You may know her as the other half of Happy Rebel Tapestries. She'll be contributing a chapter about safety at the table and what it means to keep each other's wellbeing in mind when we sit down to play together.
Sasha Reneau (they/them) is a spectacular artist and designer who excels at stirring and evocative language. You may know them as the creator of Spindlewheel. They'll be contributing a tarot glossary to help interpret Major Arcana cards at the table and make sure your game stays weird and magical even if you don’t know tarot!
Erika Shepherd (she/her) is a wonderful writer and designer whose passion and earnestness are a constant inspiration of mine. You may know her as the creator of Exodus. She’ll be contributing a chapter about road trips and vulnerability and what it means to put yourself in the hands of your companions and the people you meet along the way.

***FOR LATE BACKERS***
Late to the Raid? Missed all the action? No problem, you can still join this campaign! 
Send us a message and get the access to the pledge manager. Order your new army today!
Contact us through Facebook, Kickstarter or e-mail at support@titan-forge.com
TITAN FORGE FACEBOOK
 TITAN FORGE WEBSITE
This campaign features 2 lines of miniatures!
"Temple of Serpent" is a brand new collection inspired by the lost civilizations of Amazonia and Mesoamerica. It envisions an utopian enclave hidden so deep in the wilderness that it is considered forbidden territory. The tribe is focused on preserving an ancient magic with the help of gods and dinosaurs. Be the first to explore it!
"Bloodsail Island" is an established line of ruthless ogre pirates. Upon discovering the Temple of Serpent they have became overpowered by the desire to plunder its treasures. They are going to need every hand on deck for this one, so the line is getting a massive extension! 
Our products are in 28mm scale and come with square bases. Check rotating pictures at the bottom of our campaign to see all the details. All miniatures are made from high-quality resin that ensures highest details, durability and flexibility. 
Based on our Kickstarter experience and community feedback we have came up with the simplest Reward System to date. You can choose one of the following pledges.
***UPDATED - Now every backer that pledged at least $1 will receive a free .STL file with the Dwarven Swashbucklers. 4 amazing miniatures for 3D printing!
Deckhand Pledge is for you if you are not sure what you need but you want to be a part of the campaing. It will give you the access to the Pledge Manager where you will be able to spend your additional funds on any miniatures you want. 
Basic Pledge is for you if you do not want to pick a side. It is really simple. You plede $99 and you receive $99 to spend on addons. But on top of that you will choose and receive either a set of Serpent Freebies OR Ogre Freebies. The more SG we unlock the more value will come with those freebies packs.
In Captain Pledge you become the commander of ogre pirate army! Pledge $199 to get Captain Krabor in special offer for $40. The rest of your funds ($159) you will be able to spend in the Pledge Manager on any addons that you see fit. On top of that, you will receive  a set of Ogre Freebies. The more SG we unlock the more value will come with your freebies packs.

In Serpent Pledge you become the deity of the Temple! Pledge $199 to get High Priestess on Pterossus in a special offer for $50. The rest of your funds ($149) you will be able to spend in the Pledge Manager on any addons that you see fit. On top of that, you will receive  a set of Serpent Freebies. The more SG we unlock the more value will come with your freebies packs.
Choose your allies! Here are all the miniatures currently avaialble in both collections. Additionally, at the bottom of the campaign there is a rotating close-up of each model, so you can see every detail from every side!
 Check out the  stretch goals below. See what your endorsement will affect!




Beneath there is a list of avaliable add-ons. After the campaign ends, in the pledge manager, you will be able to spend your funds on them! Pledge today and unlock a bigger variety of heroes, creatures and troops through stretch goals!


 After the campaign ends, we will open a Pledge Manager. You will receive an e-mail address with a link to it. When you log in, you will be able to pick your rewards and spend your funds on any chosen add-ons from the campaign. You will also be able to transfer additional funds via PayPal. After finishing an order a shipping cost will be charged, based on your address and the package weight. 
All additional funds you pledge over your reward price you will be able to spend on add-ons.
When our Campaign is live we will post a link to an online calculator that will help you in figuring out how much you need to pledge to get all the miniatures you want. 
Example 1: You want just 3 units of Raptor Riders that are $39 each. In order to get them you need to choose Basic Pledge and pledge $117 (3x $39) for it. This will allow you to spend that $117 in Pledge Manager and choose 3x Raptor Riders. On top of that you will be able to choose a set of freebies (either Serpent of Ogre one).
Example 2: You want Captain Krabor, 3 units of Sharkman that are $39 each and 5 units of goblins that are $12 each. In order to get those you should choose Captain Pledge and pledge $217 for it. In this pledge Captain Krabor is in a better price and you will also get $159 for other addons. In case of any mistakes, there will be no problem with make a correction. You will always be able to add funds in the Pledge Manager via PayPal, so if you do not pledge enough through Kickstarter, you will still be able to get everything you need after the campaign ends.
Shipping will be charged in the pledge manager after our campaign ends. It will depand on the weight of the chosen products and delivery address that you will provide. You can choose more than one pledge or pick the same one multiple times but a shipping cost will be added to each of them separately. Estimated shipping rates are:

campaign.story:
Potato chips, pretzels, cheese puffs, popcorn-- who doesn't love a good snack? The only problem is, nearly all of the tastiest snacks are unhealthy. And when we turn to healthier snacks, most of the choices are bland and taste like cardboard (we're looking at you, kale chips!).
We've worked for over two years to bring to life a snack without any tradeoffs. To do that, we had to throw out potatoes and tortillas and create a chip out of an entirely new base-- egg whites! 
 As Featured In:
With notes of salsa and spice, our signature flavor combines the eggcitement of gourmet huevos rancheros with the convenience of a bag of chips. With only 2 net carbs per bag, it fits right in to the Keto lifestyle. Did we mention it'll get you jacked, too? Each bag of Rancheros has 10 GRAMS of protein. And as if that all weren't good enough, this flavor has 6 grams of fiber. If you watch your macros, you need some Quevos Rancheros!

Sour Cream & Onion, like all our flavors, is lactose free, but you would never know it! If you're looking for a delicious, creamy flavor with a hint of onion zest, this one's for you. Sour Cream & Onion has the same stellar macros as Quevos Rancheros-- 10 grams of protein, 2 net carbs, and 6 grams of fiber. 

A NEW FLAVOR LAUNCHING RIGHT HERE ON KICKSTARTER!
Fresh off the grill, this flavor provides the classic Barbeque chip experience. On the sweeter side but with a hint of smoke, this one on is a snack lovers dream! We pack in five grams of protein and five grams of fiber into every bag of Sweet Barbeque so you can indulge without any of the guilt of a conventional BBQ snack! 

This flavor is also a NEW INTRODUCTION to the Quevos family specially released for kickstarter! Cheddar has the same macros as Sweet Barbeque, but with a strong cheesy punch. If you like cheese, order these, please! Incredibly, despite the powerful flavor on this chip, Cheddar Quevos are lactose free.
 The T Shirt (only available in select reward tiers)
Most delicious snacks are cursed with one or more nutritional weaknesses. Often, they have artificial ingredients, high levels of sugar and unhealthy fats, and/or they're loaded with starch from sources like potatoes, corn, and white flour. On top of that, they're typically fried. And worst of all, most tasty snacks usually have deceivingly small serving sizes, making a quick snack into something close to a MEAL if we're not careful. 
Quevos were created as an answer to these nutritional problems. But we spent a painstaking amount of time making sure we didn't lose out on deliciousness as we crafted our product. After all, we wanted people to EAT our snack, not just think it was a cool idea! What we came up with is a revolution in the snack category. Quevos pack over twice as much protein and fiber into each serving than conventional snacks like potato and tortilla chips do. We get fats from superfood sources like avocado oil and chia seeds. Our chips are gluten free, lactose free, and soy free. Quevos don't have artificial ingredients, and they're not fried. And to put a cherry on top, each bag (one serving) is over 30 chips! Quevos leave you satisfied-- happy with a delicious snack and full and nourished from our incredible nutrient composition! 
Also Contains: Milk (ghee)
Please note: Our facility also processes tree nuts, wheat, peanuts, and soybeans. 
Zack, our co founder, is type 1 diabetic and frequently cooks egg whites as a low carb snack. His favorite part of any egg dish he makes are the crispy pieces left in the pan. In June 2016, he was eating some egg white crispies and couldn't help but think about how they crunched and cracked just like potato chips. He wondered, "Is it possible to make a chip out of egg whites?" He saw the potential for a higher protein, lower carb, and overall more nutritious snack. So he called Nick (his best friend since age 9!) over and they began formulating in Zack's kitchen. 
June 2016: First prototype batch. Our baby was ugly!
Things got serious when Nick took the idea for Quevos and our early prototypes to the New Venture Challenge at University of Chicago. Ben, David, Nick, and Zack spent 10 weeks in a rigorous business development course that taught us about customer discovery, market sizing, financial projections, and creating a business plan. At the end of the course, we pitched to a panel of 19 investors who judged us against the 9 other teams in the class. We won first place, taking home $15,000 from the Booth School of Business.
March 2018: We took this to the bank and they didn't accept it :(
For most of last year, our main focus was perfecting our product. We used our early seed funding to buy hundreds of ingredients, which we tried out in over a thousand different combinations. Plus, we experimented with different cooking processes at a pilot production lab we rented space in. To get feedback on each new version, we sampled with healthy snackers in gyms and health food shops around Chicago. Slowly, but surely, Quevos were improving.
June 2018: David, Ben, and Nick sampling product at the the IDEA Fit convention in San Diego

Feedback on Quevos had become very positive by the fall of 2018 and we knew we were ready to go. Zack and Nick were working long days during the summer, and it was clear that we wouldn't be able to commit to both Quevos and our education fully. So we dropped out of college to work on Quevos full time! We found a commercial kitchen space, began production, and launched our market test around Chicago stores and online. It was tremendous to finally have a product in a package on a shelf. Our idea had become a reality! 
November 2018: What a crazy feeling to finally get Quevos on store shelves! @Freshii in Chicago

The reception of Quevos has been phenomenal, so much so that we sold out of our entire inventory in March. Now we are scaling up to produce at higher volumes so we can get our snack out there to every healthy snacker in need of a better option! We can't do this alone, though. WE NEED YOUR HELP to fund our first large scale production run so that we can make thousands of bags to sell online and in natural food stores around the country!

March 2019: SOLD OUT!!
Support us! We don't want to live and work in our parents' house forever

Thanks for reading!! If you choose to support our growth, we really really appreciate it!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are abundant risks with any startup company bringing a product to market. Thankfully, we have already gone through a good portion of them. We completed a market test over the last 4 months, selling online on quevos.com and in ten stores around Chicago. The reception Quevos received was fantastic, which is why we are scaling up our manufacturing facility and launching in earnest now. We need your help fronting the costs of a large production run we want to do in May. If all goes according to plan and we hit our goal in this Kickstarter, we will ship out your rewards in June!

Since we need to buy new packaging equipment and that has a lead time between 3-6 weeks, there could be delays which cause our shipments to arrive at your door in July. But rest assured, if we hit our funding goal we'll go straight into squaring everything away for production and then start manufacturing bags of Quevos by the thousands!

Dear Backers,

We wanted to update you on some big news-- Quevos are now on the shelves in every Whole Foods location in Illinois! We are working as hard as we can to expand nationally but it's a super exciting start! If you're in IL, check us out at your local store or on Prime Grocery. Hey Everyone,

Books with Pictures is a comic book store in Portland, OR. We were built from the ground up to prioritize inclusivity and diverse representation. We want to be the shop where we can say YES! to anyone who walks in and asks "Do you have any stories with someone who's like me?" Our staff listens closely to each customer's interests and curiosities to help open new doors.
In early 2019, Books with Pictures owner Katie Proctor worked with a group of friends and supporters to purchase an historic building in SE Portland to serve as the new, sustainable, expanded home for Books with Pictures. 
THIS ONE!
Now, we need to finish the space and move in! Help us raise money to pay for building renovations and repair, new shop fixtures, moving expenses, and more, while getting yourself some amazing new art and merch.

In this pin, by Kory Bing, the open pages interpret the distinctive street grid of our new neighborhood in Portland, Ladd's Addition, as a rainbow-colored comics spread, with a glitter star calling out our new location. Books with Pictures' owner Katie Proctor is a queer single mother of two who has lived in Portland since 2009. Katie has worked and volunteered in bike advocacy, literary administration, education, and tech. She has been running Books with Pictures full time since Free Comic Book Day 2016. She loves Bitch Planet and The Wicked and the Divine and Squirrel Girl and A-Force and Die and My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic and Hickman's Avengers and is built of enthusiasm and nurturance.
The other face you'll most often see at Books with Pictures is Nick Orr. Nick received his BFA in Illustration from the College for Creative Studies in Detroit, Michigan. After graduating he moved to LA and worked as a freelance graphic designer and artist. He spent his time fine-tuning his craft and figuring out how best to convey a story. Nick moved to Portland in 2007. After years working at Barnes & Noble, he joined Katie's team to open Books with Pictures in 2016, first part-time, and then full-time. In 2018, Nick completed the Helioscope Studio mentorship program for artists, and in 2019 will be an invited artist at the Lake Oswego Festival of the Arts. His print "Take Me Away" is one of our backer rewards. 
Nicole Hawthorne is from Reno, Nevada, and moved to Portland for school and friendship. Currently she’s working on establishing herself as a freelance artist, but for now she spends most of her days selling, reading, and talking about comics. She also works at an escape room guiding people through puzzles and making sure they don’t break things. When she is not at either of her amazing jobs she’s home with her spouse and two cats watching cartoons. Some of her favorite comics are Snotgirl, Crowded, and The Wicked + The Divine, and she could talk for hours on end about the web comics she reads.
Seaerra Miller grew up in central Wyoming and moved to Portland to attend the Pacific Northwest College of Art and Design to study illustration. Since graduating in 2017 she has worked with with clients including Snapchat, Oni Press, and the City of Portland. She has also illustrated three books for Flying Eye and is currently working on a series of middle grade comics for them. When she’s not reading, selling, or drawing comics she likes watching bad movies and listening to sad 80’s music. Some of her favorite comics include Blue Monday, Giant Days, and Kiss Number 8.
  Katie and the BwP Crew!
The building at 1401 SE Division St was built in 1927 to hold the Crucciola family's grocery store and butcher shop, with an outbuilding for keeping chickens just behind. Patriarch Antonio Crucciola passed away in 1946, but the neighborhood grocery carried on. By 1964, the building was in the hands of J.P. Wilder, who started advertising for shop workers and delivery personnel for his business, J.P. Wilder Company, repairing automobile brakes and clutches. The chicken coop became a machine shop, and the dirt lot was paved. The last ad for shop workers ran in 1968. By 1975 the building was tied to ads in the Oregonian for "BOOKS BOOKS BOOKS." Since then--nearly half its life--this two-story wood-frame live-above retail shop has been a spot for literature.

                             In 1976 the shop, Serendipity Corner Books, was purchased by Jean Bader and her friend and “silent partner” Frank Barst; it was already a “cluttered old bookstore, then filled with empty soda bottles and sloppy stacks of musty books and magazines,” Jean told the Oregonian. Serendipity sold used books, as well as both used and new comics, until 1986, when Jean moved to Lincoln City to manage a bookstore there.

                             From 1985 to 1991, the shop was leased to Pegasus Books, the multi-branched comics chain that would eventually become Things From Another World. In 1991, Jon Hagen bought it and moved his decade-old store Longfellow’s Books and Records there from its Moreland neighborhood location on SE Milwaukee. Longfellow’s specialized in rare and antiquarian books, and also carried extensive runs of old magazines and rare folk records collected on Jon’s scouting trips up and down the Oregon coast. For the past decade, Jon’s son Nile had been helping him run the business, especially its online presence. In 2016, the Oregonian voted Longfellow’s a “uniquely Portland experience,” and their “favorite bookstore.” Jon died on Jan. 25 of last year, at the age of 80, and Nile put the building up for sale in the fall.

                             Katie first spoke with Nile about buying it on November 6, Election Day: “When Nile told me he was selling the building, I thought, ‘there is no possible way I can do that.’ And then I rushed home and called a bunch of people to figure out how to do it.” She wound up forming the limited liability corporation Building for Books LLC, and bringing together about twenty friends and supporters to help make the purchase. Her plans for the space include not just a bigger, better Books with Pictures, but also a record store in the basement and a food cart pod in the parking lot. The new plans for this Building for Books touch on many of its roots: food, comics, books, music. But most importantly, it will bring new life to this beloved neighborhood corner. And the apartment above? Katie is thrilled to get to live there, with her two kids and their old-lady cat, Pixel.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of our rewards are either already complete or in process; we have contracts ready to go with silk-screeners and pin-makers. However, managing fulfillment at the same time as completing our move will make for some tricky time crunches-- we expect we won't be able to start serious mailing parties until late June or early July, and depending on how many supporters we get, it may take a while to get all of those packages out the door. It is important to us that your art, pins, and bags reach you safely, and we hope you'll be patient with us as we get everything packed and mailed.

updates.update_content:
Hello, friends and supporters,
I'm writing with relief and gratitude: with one last package going out today, reward shipping is complete.

Thank you all so much for your support. I'm so grateful for all you've done for us, and I love seeing more and more of you come visit the new space.
Rewards are making their way out, but slowly, and with errors. I learned yesterday that one package arrived postage-due, in spite of the assurances of my mailing software. I am SO sorry that this happened-- I'm taking steps to avoid it on future shipments. Other packages have been returned for one reason or another, and we're reaching out to people as this happens.

updates.update_userinfo: For Halloween: A Problem of Missing Guts
updates.update_content: Hello! Here’s a spooky trick: we somehow set up our fulfillment software such that it isn’t distinguishing between those of you who ordered just a tote bag, and those who are expecting totes filled with exciting random goodies! If you receive a bag in mail in the next few days that is distressingly guts-less, don’t fret: we’re working out the glitch and will make sure you get your treats as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience! Katie
The first set of packages are going out today. Thanks so much for your support and patience. I’m so delighted to start putting these rewards into your hands!! With love and gratitude, Katie

...and so are our pins! 
Hey all, sorry for the delay in an update. We are SO close to having all the pin in our hands. That is the last bit we need before shipments out rewards. We have the bags, the prints, and everything else, but the pins.
On the other side of things in you've been following us on Facebook the new space is more beautiful than what we could have imagined and things are rolling along.

Greetings Friends, 
We are in the final stages of collecting all of the wonderful goodies that you folks are anxiously waiting for.  So far so good. 
We are a bit behind schedule but rest assured that we are on task and putting together packages.  We expect shipping to be a bit delayed; most likely in September.

Dear Backers,
Well this has been one heck of a month. We closed the shop for just seven days toward the end of June, during which we, with a TON of volunteers, packed, moved, installed shelves, unpacked, shelved, and sorted. And were open again for events with Leila and Rosa Del Duca, Dylan Meconis, and more, the very next week. We have been LOVING the neighborhood welcome and improved foot traffic in our new digs, and had a hopping opening party last Saturday night. If you haven't been in yet, you should definitely come see us soon, and be PROUD of what we've accomplished together.

We cannot thank you all enough for the love, kindness, and support.  Your generosity throughout this campaign has been truly astounding. It brings us to tears (in a good way).
Look out for your backer kit surveys that will be hitting your inbox in about a week's time. There you will be able to solidify your order AND add on ANYTHING else that we have available; totes, prints, enamel pins, and art.

In our last few hours, we have been able to add some great new rewards. Check them out!!
TWO original watercolor pages of Janet Lee’s adaptation of Jane Austen’s Emma.
Just THREE curated tote bags STUFFED with extremely limited, out-of-print, not-for-sale Man-Eaters comics and swag from Chelsea Cain and the Man-Eaters team.

Current Goal



Welcome to Humblewood! 
Humblewood is an exciting new Campaign Setting for 5e DND that includes original birdfolk player races, new monsters, magic items, and a compelling adventure for 1st to 5th level characters.
 The World
In the world of Everden, nestled between the mighty Crest mountain range and the vast marshes of the Mokk Fields, lies a mystical forest known as Humblewood that hums with the Great Rhythm of nature. It has been ruled for generations by the birdfolk who inhabit the Great Tree-City of Alderheart. Humblewood has endured for centuries thanks to the industry and compassion of its people...
...but now the fires have come, and the Woods have been thrown into chaos. Flames ravage the land and destroy the homes of the humblefolk, stoking a growing resentment against the birdfolk, whose cities have managed to avoid the worst of the fires so far. Hatred burns in the hearts of those who have lost lives they cherished, and these once peaceful peoples now take up the sword and turn to banditry. The disaffected turn their gaze on Alderheart, and threaten to reduce an age of peace to ashes... 
...yet there is still hope. Even in these dark times, brave heroes can be found within the Wood. Only they can quell the raging flames that have been unleashed upon the land, and restore balance to the realm. Will you answer the call?    
Residents of Humblewood
The Birdfolk 

The birdfolk races have ruled over Humblewood from their canopy villages and fortified cities for as long as anyone can remember. Play as one of the five core birdfolk races:
The astute crow-like Corvum who safeguard Humblewood’s knowledge
The dignified fowl-like Gallus who have faith in the power of community
The aloof pidgeon-like Lumas who use their gifts to bring joy into the world
The agile hawk-like Raptors who blaze new trails through the forest
The powerful owl-like Strig who defend what they believe is right
The Humblefolk
The humblefolk live in small villages throughout the Wood, but are occasionally found in birdfolk cities. Play as one of the five core humblefolk races:
The hearty deer-like Cerva who strive to achieve their goals 
The sensitive hedgehog-like Hedges whose empathy lets them see what others cannot
The brave mouse-like Jerbeen who inspire those around them with deeds of heroism
The resourceful raccoon-like Mapach who can craft a solution to any problem
The cunning fox-like Vulpin who are always one step ahead of their foes
The Bandits
Once a loosely organized confederacy of crime, its ranks have swelled with humblefolk displaced by the spreading fires who have turned to banditry to survive. Under the guidance of a new leader, they seek to exact retribution upon the birdfolk cities and sow discord throughout the Wood.
Monsters of Humblewood
The Oozes
Deep within the murk of the Mokk Fields live several species of this most resilient life-form. Battle your way through caustic slimes whose touch is a deadly acid, sticky slimes that can suck a weapon right out of your hand, and the rare shifting slimes which feed on magical energies to become ever stronger. 
The Beasts
Humblewood is home to a variety of beasts whose size, strength, and abilities can only have grown thanks to the Wood’s magic. Face craggy skinned mountain lions whose roar can summon rockslides, hunt the deadly forest prowlers in their woodland lair, and tangle with the giant sea monster (art coming soon!) in a battle on the high sea!
The Elements of Flame

The great calamity which produced the part of Humblewood known as the Scorched Grove also made the area an ideal home for fiery creatures. Withstand the searing heat of an emberbat swarm: a vortex of tiny flying creatures, each one a smouldering ember with wings! Confront the terrifying ashsnake and it’s deadly pyroclastic breath! Legends say there may even be a primal elemental force lurking within the Scorched Grove. Have you the courage to find out? 
This campaign is shipping friendly to USA, European Union and Canada.
