campaign.story:
Enter into a shadow war between two Fae Courts in your own city, as you’re thrown headlong into a world of extremes and contradiction where you have to adapt to a new reality or perish. Play characters who are becoming something less human and more like the beings found in stories—the fae, the monsters, the gods, and everything in between.
Fae Nightmares is a Modern Urban Fantasy setting for the Savage Worlds system, which nods to the genre’s roots in detective and horror stories. With the setting being a modern North American-esq city, Arden, we decided to focus on local stories. There are still Celtic Fae, as North America does have a strong European influence, but we also pulled from Native American stories, urban myths, and lumberjack tall tales. And besides, we have some things that are ridiculously cool and don’t get enough play.
Despite the large city, there’s a small community feel in the game as the number of Fae and Nightmares measure in the hundreds. This, and the shape-shifting nature of many characters, have contributed to the setting being particularly gender neutral, and queer & LGBT friendly. With the smaller “relevant” populations there are some new social mechanics, notably the effect of status within the courts on interactions, and the trickery skill. Both of which reflect features heavily found in both Celtic Fairy Tales and Native American stories.
We have 4 flexible character "races", 5 arcane backgrounds, and edges that focus on your character’s progression into something supernatural. For the GM we have 2 plot point campaigns, a plethora of savage tales, location based encounters, and a selection of magical items. In addition, we have equipment, game and Fae personality generators. In the game generators, we not only have your usual combat games, but also social and investigative focused tables.
We’ve put a lot of work into this book, both the world, and making sure that everything mechanical we added was both necessary and reflected the setting. Over the course of a year, we’ve designed the world and run two playtest campaigns. We’re done most of the writing, the majority of the work left is in paring down and cleaning up the fluff, organizing and stating out the bestiary, and cleaning up changes to a few mechanics. We have a clear goal of what these will be like, but what we really need help with is art, editing, and production costs.
This is where you come in. Our goal is to get the best possible product into your hands. Our minimum goal allows us to commission art for the book, pay for an editor to go over it, and cover the costs of shipping and production of minimal books. At our initial goal we’ll be producing a POD version of the book, with about 30 pictures, but our initial stretch goals work towards commissioning more, and better, art, and a higher quality book with offset printing. Our secondary goal is to produce the player’s guide we want; organized to reflect the varying levels of knowledge PCs may have of the world, with expanded archetypes for pick-up games or use as NPCs, and actual-play examples of the new mechanics.
We’re hoping you’ll like this world as much as we do, and we’re looking forward to your feedback!
We have some sample pages of Fae Nightmares up, and If you’d like to see more of our work, check out issues 6, 8 and 9 of Savage Insider, where we wrote the “Halloween Jack and Jill”, “Corroders”, and “Mask Peddler” pieces.
Thanks! Mariah and Brett

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks
This is our first published RPG, so its possible there's a roadblock we're missing, however, we've done a lot of research, are consulting with people with previous Kickstarter experience, and working with an established company for printing, so hopefully these are minimized. In addition, we're keeping the project as simple as possible.

Writing
The two of us are the writing and production team, so if something drastic happens it will slow us down, though we've accounted time for this. However, it also means we don't have to worry about outside writers flaking on us or not meeting their deadlines! Most of the book is written, and just needs cleanup, and can easily be worked on by just one of us if necessary. All the files are backed up on an external drive and on the cloud regularly, so chances of data loss are small. 

Art
The art is being done by other people, so any delays there will delay the project, if they exceed the expected lag time. Should this get extreme it is possible for Mariah, one of the writers, to also do illustrations for the book, though this would slow us down.

Shipping
Costs could go up again. However, we've budged for possible increases, and we're committed to getting the product to you.

Exchange Rate
While this project is using Canadian dollars, most of it will be spent in USD. We've built in a bit of "wiggle room" to account for fluctuations in exchange rates. Though, they haven’t changed too much in the last little while, and projections stay well within a reasonable range.

Risks and challenges
What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories:
1) Overall Non-completion
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates
3) We do not produce a specific model or change one.

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed one massive Kickstarter and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of a Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment, no matter the size, against loss and damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We learned a lot during our first Kickstarter. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that would help us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays are easy to solve, such as replacing a printer that is creating barcodes that a particular USPS hub is having a problem reading. Other delays are out of our hands, such as the 2012 longshoreman strike that delayed two of our overseas containers. We have even intentionally created delays when we chose to change models already in production to make them better.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in the model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for a buy in level model. This event did not occur in our previous Kickstarter but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops we will issue a refund or credit depending on your desire for the buy in pledge amount for the model. Also we reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.

In summary we have the knowledge, wisdom and know how to prevent, solve, and work through just about any problem that we will face and will do everything possible to make this an exciting and enjoyable event.

Wrath of Kings is a miniatures war game, where players take command of the armies of one of the five kingdoms of Arikania!  Scalable from 10 to 50 models per side, now you can vie for the throne of the Ancient King!
To: Chairwoman Arkayla Galt, Free Cities Council, at Kylos
From: Envoy Jeyna Harig in Fructus City
"Chairwoman, forgive this hasty scrawl, but I have little time.
The summit does not go well. I fear that without some miracle, each free city state will find itself beset by the five Scion Nations in a very short time. Some will come to conquer, others will come to defend, but all will be making war..."
Combining the talents of the best artists, sculptors and writers in the business, Wrath of Kings has been in development for over 3 years and now is almost ready to launch...
We've just finished sculpting (and in some cases, creating the molds and first test shots) of the first wave of release for each of the 5 Kingdoms.
With this Kickstarter, we hope to bring you an entire year's worth of releases in one shot, with all Kingdoms available immediately from launch, rather than as staggered releases - as well as provide you opponents to play against at launch, and a great deal on some amazing miniatures!
The Kingdoms
"Shael Han's demon powered armies appear to be well under the heel of their masters, but who is to say how long this state of affairs will endure?  There is something unnerving about their careless sacrifice of souls and living bodies for greater power.  Their ambassador is noncommittal and maddeningly vague - we should not rely on them as allies..." - Envoy Harig
"Kartoresh’s Ashman Legions are said to be engaging in nothing more than training exercises across our northern borders. And yet we know their military recruitment has tripled, and exports for war material has similarly increased, especially in the specialty lacquers and paints used for their magical war masks. And Scion King Nasier himself is said to have removed the Ancient King’s traditional war mask from the vaults." - Envoy Harig
"In the south, Felskar’s vast military-industrial complex never truly wound down after their ‘glorious humanum uprising,’ as their ambassador calls it. Their ambassador tells me they are retooling to broaden the scope of their technological revolution, but then why do this with the military alone? They rid themselves of ‘ruling classes’ and see it as their responsibility to do the same for all other nations." - Envoy Harig 
"As for Telloria, their vampire ambassador watches everything from his shadowed seat. He smiles often, speaks much, but says little. It is nigh impossible to fathom minds that think in decades rather than years. When war comes, I fear we’ll have no warning when their Night Legion strikes forth into our borders. We can only hope they hit Kartoresh or Achrion first." - Envoy Harig  
"The Hadrossian Ambassador categorically denies establishing underwater bases across the whole of the Arikan Sea floor. Yet we know their attacks on Kartoresh maritime forces alone have increased tenfold over the last two years, dragging enemy ships down to the depths despite the lack of a formal declaration of war." - Envoy Harig
Gencon 2013 interviews
We did a huge number of demos over the Gencon weekend, and folks almost universally loved the gameplay and models.   Check out these interviews!
Gameplay
With a unique one roll resolution system and an active chain of command, you'll feel like you're actually in charge of an army without being bogged down in tedious tracking.  Combat is fast, fluid, furious and tactical - your decisions will matter on the battlefield!
Models
The models in this wave are in plastic, with weapons in polystyrene so that they keep nice straight edges on spear shafts, handles, and large sword blades etc. 

For a selection we received straight from the factory at Gencon, check out this update: http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/coolminiornot/wrath-of-kings/posts/571869

But what better way to show you the models than to paint one - note this is an actual production model, not a resin master!
Pledge Levels
One Faction Starter of your choice, proposed MSRP of $60, delivered straight to your door.
2 Faction Starters of your choice, a hardback rulebook with variant exclusive* cover, and an exclusive* sculpt of  "Iron Eyes"! $160 MSRP.
Irene von Goritsi – “Iron Eyes”
Irene “Iron Eyes” von Goritsi once served Telloria’s Sovereign as a personal spy and private assassin. More than one house of cards in Telloria’s murky political landscape has tumbled to ruin by Irene’s hand in service to Queen Goritsi. However, Irene has committed the ultimate sin in her Sovereign’s eyes by refusing the Gift of vampirism. The Gift cannot be given, only received from  whatever dark forces seethe within Telloria’s borders beneath the shadowy forests and moonlit peaks.
As a result, Irene has been exiled to Fructus Isle, a home to pirates, criminal masterminds, and political refugees. The Sovereign hopes that the brewing conflicts and the stress of the coming international summit will push Irene into accepting the Gift. Irene has her own ideas, and now considers herself a free agent, selling her services to the highest, or in some cases, most interesting bidder.
Irene is most at home in the shadows, observing enemy movements, or sneaking into their camps to steal away vital intelligence. In her role as an assassin, she prefers to strike unseen, when she can maximize her opening blow. With preparation, she can exploit even the strongest opponent’s weaknesses. She’s a predator among predators, and her powers can only grow.
Irene’s nickname was come by honestly, although she despises its use. When in a great passion, or caught unawares, her eyes turn a solid, metallic black. It reminds her constantly that she must remain vigilant against her strongest emotions, lest she succumb to the Gift.
   All 5 Faction Starters, a hardback rulebook with variant exclusive cover, and an exclusive sculpt of "Iron Eyes"! ($340 MSRP).

Our Texture and Accent stamps are designed to allow anyone to create bases for their wargaming & RPG miniatures that look professionally sculpted, with little need of money, time, or even skill.  Textures have simple patterns like bricks or stone while accents have items like sewer covers or bones to add interest.  To use the stamps all you need is to put a little sculpting putty on your base and press the stamp pattern you want, then allow the putty to harden.  Multiple stamping may be needed when mixing and matching textures and accents, but they give the sculptor endless possibilities of bases for a fraction of the cost of resin bases, an almost no time compared to gluing together bits.  Advanced sculptors can use the stamps as a jumping off point to reduce project sculpting time.
Our stamps are made of a urethane rubber, and are 3/8" thick made to last for years.  They are 3" X 5" to allow for larger bases and greater variety of texture.
1. Allow us to create a higher quality product- We are looking to get our master molds 3D printed. This will allow us to “crisp up” the stamp edges and textures like steel plates, tiles, and accents.  The stamps will also gain some details we could not even think of offering prior to this project. You can see in the photos below the dramatic improvement your support will have.  
2. Allow us to improve the line- We are at the point of deciding what is working and what needs improvement. This will involve increasing the number of accents and adding some support products like putty and bases. With stretch goals we can add even more.
3. Help us get the product out there- We have be quite successful so far, selling well over 500 stamps with little to no marketing, just word of mouth and some reviews. Kickstarter itself will help us get the word out, and a cleaner product will allow us to sell through more means than just our own online store.  Retailers who have used our stamps agree that the product is great and worth carrying, but they all agree the stamps need to look cleaner if we want to see it on their walls, or more importantly flying off their walls.
4. Put the our stamps in your hands!- Let’s face we all like to come to Kickstarter for two things support ideas we believe in and the SWAG! Ask anyone who has contacted us for tournament support or customer service, we want to see people happily using our stamps, this campaign will be no different. Just look at our pledges, we start with a chance to get more stamps for your buck during the campaign, and we will be throwing in some basing putty. Our stretch goals will add even more; we are planning on free bases, more stamps, and some surprises!
This is the kind of improvement you should expect to see in our stamps from this Kickstarter. Both tan stamps were pulled from prototype molds that our 3D printer sent us, the black ones are from our hand made molds we are using now. While one or two small tweaks are in order for the Sewers & Grates Stamp, we are quite excited with possibilities of this new production level!
When we meet goal we will be producing 20 different stamps (15 Textures and 5 Accent) plus the pledge sampler stamp, more stamps will be unlocked with stretch goals.   We will be 3D printing the new molds so that lines will be crisper and cleaner, things like tiles & steel will be more uniform, and the details can be more complex.  Here are some 50mm bases that have been created with the stamps we have produced over the past two years.  Remember the new molds will make these look even cleaner! Many of the first fifteen textures will be similar to what we have already produced, with a few new ones added to the line.  All of the accents will be new. Be sure to watch the update section for renderings of the new mold plates so you can see what impressions will left on your base after stamping. 
The Pledge Sampler Stamp- This stamp will have four patterns on it, similar to the textures above. Measuring in at 3.5" X 3.5" it is great for the hobby person on the go.  It will include: Flag Stone, Narrow Wood, Random Steel Plate, and one Kickstarter exclusive texture, MASS GRAVE, which will consist of a layer of human bones.  It will also be labeled on the side to show you pledged to our Kickstarter.  
On the left is the CAD drawing of the sampler textures that will be printed. The Mass Grave you see to the right will go in that blank spot you see on the CAD drawing.  The bases are a 20mm square & 30mm round to show you the scale.  For more detailed pictures check out updates #7 & #8.
For those that would like a second and third opinion, we have had a number of reviews including some demos on other websites.  With Podcasts we have posted the time stamp to the start of our review, but it would be great if you could listen to the whole thing out of respect of the Pod Casters who put a lot of work into their shows.
Shiny Penny Musings- written review with pictures about a 1/3 of the way down the page.  http://shinypennymusings.tumblr.com/
Boosted Damage Podcast- around the 39:30 mark. http://www.boosteddamage.com/?p=440
The Eternal Warriors- Right at the start of the podcast "easier than painting". 
http://ec.libsyn.com/p/e/e/c/eec53dd31748a8db/Episode_36.mp3d13a76d516d9dec20c3d276ce028ed5089ab1ce3dae902ea1d01cf8734d9c95ddd22&c_id=4417653
Hand Cannon Online came up with some great demos of some advanced basing work that becomes super easy with our texture stamps.  We also are proud of being listed on their top ten gift list for two Holiday Seasons in a row now. 
http://handcannononline.com/blog/2011/07/21/basing-basics-part-1-with-happy-seppuku-terrain-stamps/ 
http://handcannononline.com/blog/2011/08/23/basing-basics-part-with-happy-seppuku-terrain-stamps/
Wargaming Tradecraft- A great brand new review of our pre-kickstarter product with some alternative ways to bring the textures from the stamp to your base.
http://www.wargamingtradecraft.com/2013/07/review-stamping-with-happy-seppukus.html
For those wanting a bit more here are some extras you can purchase to help you in with your base stamping needs.  To purchase add-ons, pledge an additional dollar amount, over your chosen pledge, equal to the extras you would like. After the campaign the survey we will send you will have a spot for you to inform us which add-ons you wanted.
Happy Seppuku Model Works is a family owned company that is dedicated to helping others in the hobby we love. We like to find new and inventive ways to improve the models and scenery of their games, all while trying to help our customers save money in the long run. We have been producing our base texture stamps for two years now with great success; however we are ready to step up our game a bit. This means improving our tools and offering an even better product than what our customers are already raving about.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been producing texture stamps in house for over two years now, and we have worked out the kinks with production system, so there will be no problems there. Problems that could occur would only cause a delay, these would be:
1. Our 3D printer could get booked up. This could cause a delay of a few weeks.
2. Overwhelming success. Ironically being super successful could cause a delay, mainly with rubber supply. Our distributor tells us that the company will have enough rubber; however it may have to come for the other side of the country, if they do not have enough on hand. Great success may also mean bringing in some more people and training them on how to properly produce stamps, which could take a week or so.
3. Surprise! We cannot account for everything, me getting hit by a bus, aliens blasting our work shop. We can tell you that we and those already enjoying our stamps believe in this project and Happy Seppuku will keep you in the loop should the unexpected happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Team,
We wanted you to know that Happy Seppuku is changing the way you game AGAIN! We recently just launched a Kickstarter for a brand new material called MagRelief, and we would like you to join us to make it a reality.  
MagRelief is a 3D textured magnetic receptive skin so you can attach magnetic items to what ever you skin with MagRelief. The uses are limitless:

Hello Team,
We wanted to drop you all a line, and let you know we are about to launch our 3rd Kickstarter. This time we are focusing again on stamps.
THE STAMPEDE- Happy Seppuku Model Work’s 2015 Kickstarter the STAMPEDE is where we plan to release between 9 and 18 new textures and introduce full Scenic Stamps. During our second Kickstarter, the Your Board Kickstarter, the number one message from people was that they “just wanted more stamps”. So this time we are going back to our roots (sort of) the STAMPEDE will focus on just stamps. We are making some changes with our stamps that will do several things meant to get us into retailers; reduce sale price, increase production speed, decrease production errors, and allow us to make both 3”x3” and 6”x6” versions of our stamps. The STAMPEDE starts the morning of October 23rd! Warn your friends!

Having fun with you stamps? Want to do more with them?  We just launched our Your Board Kickstarter where you can actually you helped make here to make a full set of gaming (dungeon) tiles!  We would like to say more but we will keep this short and let the page speak for its self.  
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/texturestamps/your-board-create-your-own-dungeon-tiles

Hey Team,
We have just posted today that we are taking pre-sale orders for the "My Accents" pledge stamp funded during the Kickstarter.  It is called the "E.M.K. Steam Lab," and it contains a lot of steam punk items including varied gears (horizontal & vertical); a robot arm with three tools that can be used with it (a laser apparatus, a drill, and claw); some shop tools, a spring, light bulb, three period hats, three gas masks and an umbrella.  We will be releasing it February 14th for regular sales, up until then we will be taking pre-orders at a discounted $10 price.  All orders (you can order other stamps in the same order) including pre-sale items will be held until the pre-sale items are released then shipped all together.  On a side note the other stamp we are releasing at the same time is our bamboo texture stamp.  This is the only update we will be sending through kickstarter to tell you about releases, if you would like to hear about releases when they come out please email us at feedback@happyseppuku.com and ask to be put on our mailing list.

Hey Team,
The last batch of stamps are out our door and heading to you!  We already have some people that are receiving their pledges.  Lets go over what you should expect when you open your box.
Paperwork- You should have your invoice, a report to the backers letter, and a black/white copy of the new directions (we have also added the full color direction to the  website).

Hello team,
Long=Short; PLEASE READ ALL OF THIS ONE; We apologize for the surveys, Statements of account and paypal invoices will be sent out end of Oct (two different emails), Shipping will start mid November. Updates on DVD and "My Details" backer level stamp.
Keep those surveys coming in, we have about 95% right now.  Speaking of those our first order of business is to apologize for the surveys.  When it comes to surveys you have the option of using KS's or paying someone else to handle it.  Had we known the severe limitations of KS's survey system we would have budgeted for a pledge manager.  Our expectations were just as crushed as yours.  We had no idea that they would require every field to be filled.

campaign.story:
Missed out on the Kickstarter?  Find out more about it at Dreamscarred Press! 
Miniatures help bring tabletop RPGs to life, allowing strategy and tactics during combat.  Dreamscarred Press wants to create a line of miniatures for its psionic classes and monsters and is looking for your help to get that done!
We already commissioned the first miniature to be created, Adrian the Xeph Soulknife and the sculpture is complete.  With that figurine ready, and us having learned about the miniature creation process, we are ready to scale up and get this project running!  We've lined up sculptors, a production facility, and determined the costs and time to fulfill. 
For our base project funding, we will produce a miniature for each of the four original psionic classes - the psion, psychic warrior, soulknife, and wilder, using the iconic characters detailed in Ultimate Psionics.
If we achieve higher funding, we'll add on additional miniatures to the line, including psionic monsters like the phrenic scourge or psion-killer, the other psionic classes like the aegis, and astral construct miniatures.
Note: Poses displayed may not be the final pose for the miniature
Psion - for the initial project, we'll be producing our iconic kineticist, although increased funding may allow us to produce the different specialists for the psion (generalist, nomad, telepath, etc.)
Psychic Warrior
Soulknife - sculpture already completed!
Wilder
Want all the hand-held goodies for your game?  Add on a psionic focus token, some Dreamscarred-branded dice, or printed and cut cards to complete your set!
$2 each - Psionic Focus Token

$2 each - Dreamscarred-branded d6 (logo replaces the 6)
$7 each - Dreamscarred-branded d20 (logo replaces the 20)
$10 each - one additional psionic miniature from the project of your choice (some exclusions may apply if larger miniatures are unlocked)
$10 - 4-panel GM screen with psionic support
$15 - printed and cut psionic item cards set
$20 - printed and cut power cards
Prepainted
Get your miniatures prepainted!  We have reached an agreement with a miniature painting facility to provide an upgrade for your miniatures to come prepainted.  The cost for this is $5 per miniature.  This is the cost to us, so we are giving you the option at that same cost.  Simply increase your pledge by $5 per miniature you want painted.
For a sample of the quality level of the paint job they will do, see below.
$4500 - Phrenic Scourge Achieved!
$6000 - Iconic Aegis Achieved!
$7500 - Psion-Killer Achieved!
$9000 - Iconic Noral Dread Achieved!
$10500 - Forgeborn Achieved!
$12000 - Iconic Dromite Tactician Achieved!
$13500 - Iconic Elan Cryptic Achieved!
$15000 - Ophiduan Vitalist Achieved!
$16,500 - Astral Construct Achieved!
Graphic pending
$18,000 - Iconic Marksman Achieved!
$20,000 - Intellect Devourer
$22,000 - Duergar
$24,000 - Psicrystals!
$26,000 - Prestige Class!
$28,000 - LOCKED!
And even more to come as we achieve higher funding!
Since we cannot update the rewards text once they have been selected, below are what each tier gets and we'll keep it updated as the project progresses.
$10 - You get one miniature of your choice from the project.
$30 - You get one of each of the four original psionic classes (psion, psychic warrior, soulknife, wilder)
$60 - Get ten different miniatures of your choice from those unlocked (maximum 1 of any particular miniature).
$75 - ALL GONE! - Get all the miniatures of the project - including miniatures from stretch goals! At a minimum, you will get ten miniatures, using additional copies of the miniatures unlocked to fill in your reward.
$100 - Get all the miniatures of the project - including miniatures from stretch goals! Currently at SIXTEEN miniatures!
$100 - ALL GONE! - Ultimate accessories level - one of every miniature we produce through this project, including any unlocked from stretch goals! Also get the Ultimate Psionics GM Screen (plus PDF), five psionic focus tokens, a set of 2 Dreamscarred branded d6 and a Dreamscarred branded d20, printed and cut psionic power cards (plus PDF), and printed and cut psionic item cards (plus PDF)!
$100 - ALL GONE! - Get everything you need to get started with psionics - Ultimate Psionics color hardcover and PDF, Psionic Bestiary color softcover and PDF, and one of every miniature we produce through this project, including any unlocked from stretch goals!
$140 - Get everything you need to get started with psionics - Ultimate Psionics color hardcover and PDF, Psionic Bestiary color softcover and PDF, and one of every miniature we produce through this project, including any unlocked from stretch goals!
$150 - ALL GONE! - The ultimate starter package due to popular demand - one of every miniature from the project - including all stretch goals, a color hardcover copy and PDF of Ultimate Psionics, a color softcover copy and PDF of Psionic Bestiary, the Ultimate Psionics GM Screen and PDF, five psionic focus tokens, a set of 2 Dreamscarred branded d6 and a Dreamscarred branded d20, printed and cut psionic power cards and PDF, and printed and cut psionic item cards and pdf!
$350 - Limited Availability - Get one of every miniature produced in this project, including all stretch goals unlocked, plus get color copies and PDFs of Psionic Bestiary, Psionics Embodied, the Ultimate Psionics poster, the psionic GM Screen, and the LIMITED EDITION color hardcover of Ultimate Psionics.
$1000 - Only One Available - Get a miniature for your character! Your character will be illustrated, sculpted, and turned into 28 mm metal miniature. In addition, your character will be fully detailed and released in either an upcoming adventure OR as part of our Psionics Embodied product line, and you'll receive a color print of the release. In addition, we'll throw in one of EVERY miniature in the project, and a LIMITED EDITION copy of Ultimate Psionics!  Due to the nature of custom artwork, there is no guarantee that the exact mental image you have of your character will be what is produced, but every effort will be made to produce the character you envision, within reason.  Also keep in mind physics and what can actually be done with metal.
$1000 - Only One Available - Get your psionic monster designed and made into a miniature! Your monster description will be illustrated, sculpted, and turned into a metal miniature. In addition, your creature will be fully detailed and released in our Psionics Bestiary product line, and you'll receive a color print of the release. In addition, we'll throw in one of EVERY miniature in the project, and a LIMITED EDITION copy of Ultimate Psionics!  Due to the nature of custom artwork, there is no guarantee that the exact mental image you have of your character will be what is produced, but every effort will be made to produce the character you envision, within reason.  Also keep in mind physics and what can actually be done with metal.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The big challenge we have is that we will be using contractors to sculpt the miniatures, as this is not a skill set we have in-house. However, that is why we produced an initial miniature to prove that we have the resources available to get the work done. Depending on the success of the Kickstarter, we will reach out to additional sculptors to spread out the work.

In addition, depending on the success of the project and the number of miniatures that the final project generates, the timeline of delivery may be extended, since with the exception of the soulknife, all miniatures need to be produced from scratch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
My apologies for the delay in this update - but fulfillment has been progressing.
Since I'm single-handed in packing and shipping the rewards for both this project and the Ultimate Psionics Kickstarter, things are going slowly, but we're nearing the finish line. There are only a few backers remaining who need portions of their rewards!
As I get rewards out for the Ultimate Psionics Kickstarter, I'm also getting some shipments out for this project. Several of you should have received updates this weekend of orders being completed and shipping out. I'm hoping to have the remaining out by the end of the month - vacation from the day job allowing me time to cut and box power and item cards should help - since that's just about all that's remaining of the rewards left to ship.

Since we're largely at the point of this project where most that remains to be shipped are cards - good news! Cards have started shipping! I have hundreds of sets to ship between this Kickstarter and our Ultimate Psionics Kickstarter, but I'm finally getting some out the door.
I've only a few dozen sets that were both printed AND cut - dozens more waiting to be cut.

My apologies for the folks here waiting on cards - I'd been posting updates on them on the Ultimate Psionics Kickstarter, but hadn't posted that here...
Here's the latest!
Greetings from the road!  
I have good news and bad news on the power cards (and item cards) - I picked up a big batch of power cards from getting professionally cut (doing it with a sliding paper cutter when we have over a hundred thousand cards to cut is just not realistic) - sets are ready to ship (or pickup at GenCon for those of you who asked me about that), but the cost was significantly higher than I was initially quoted... costing more than $7 per set of cards just to cut. And with the volume of cards, getting them to the shop in my tiny car meant about fifteen separate trips (10 sets of cards was a large box).

I know many of you are waiting on your cards (either power or item or both) - I just wanted to give an update on that, just as I did on the Ultimate Psionics Kickstarter project today.
After a lot of phone calls, emails, online research into local printers, online printers, chain printers, and more, we've finally found a printer for the power and item cards that is within our budget while leaving the cards still readable. The downside is it's going to take about a month to get them all printed up and cut, and then it's once again me having to pack and ship everything. However, we've at least finally found a solution after running into obstacle after obstacle. I've got all the boxes ready to pack the cards up once they're printed and cut and plenty of USPS boxes to ship them out. And since the cards should require significantly less work boxing up than the hardcovers did, I'm hoping to plow through them like I was mostly able to do when shipping out miniatures (smaller boxes, less packing material, etc).

Hi everybody!
We are nearing the end of reward fulfillment! Right now, over 90% of the miniatures have shipped out, and over 80% of backers have received all physical rewards. The discrepancy is those backers who got minis and the power or item cards - we're still working on getting those produced at a price level we can afford and a quality level that's acceptable. I'm working to have that completed this month.

Greetings, folks, for an update on progress! First, my apologies for the delay in the update - as those of you who also backed Ultimate Psionics know, we just finished moving after a month-long process and it's been extremely hectic. I'm trying to get things organized to streamline shipments, but it's been difficult with boxes everywhere cluttering up my work space.  
More orders have gone out, and progress is being made on shipping the books and minis separately, as well. We've been past the 50% mark for orders that have been fulfilled for a while, just working toward getting to that 100% mark.

My apologies for delayed updates. Some of you were also part of the Ultimate Psionics Kickstarter and might have seen in the last update that the past month or so at my day job has been 60+ hour work weeks, which translates to having almost no time in the nights and weekends to work on this. Combined with a 10-month old daughter who still won’t sleep through the night, it’s just been a beat down. Thankfully, it looks like things are starting to die down and a semblance of normalcy will hopefully return allowing me to process multiple orders every day.

Hi folks!  Since it's been a while, it seemed appropriate to give an update.  Shipments continue to go out, including international shipments now that I've received confirmation from a postal worker of how to properly package.  It never helps when you get conflicting instructions.
You should receive an email from our store when your reward ships with a notice that your order has been completed.  Any rewards that include the printed cards (power or item) will likely be shipping last, although I'm looking into ways to break up order shipments - right now, I only know if the order is "completed" or "on hold" - so shipping out half makes it even more difficult to find which ones have had some stuff but not all stuff shipped.

Howdy folks!  I just got news that the minis are shipping out to me today!  They should arrive later this week and then I get the fun of packing everything up.
However, there are a couple dozen backers who have still not selected their rewards.  I'll be contacting those backers directly because one miniature in particular, the psion-killer, is going to get a significant price increase for general release, and I don't want anyone to miss out at the Kickstarter rate before it's too late.  Given the cost of the metal, the psion-killer is likely going to cost $20 or more each, it's just that massive.  The price in the store is going to go up in one week's time (July 21st).

I received an update today that the full casting run should be finished and out the door to me early next week!  That means it should arrive late next week or around the 21st, at which point I get to start packing up orders for shipment!
I've also placed the print order for Psionic Bestiary, for those whose orders include that, because the goal is to ship everything in a single shipment.
If things go smoothly, just about everything should ship by the end of July!

campaign.story:
Welcome to DGS Games Kickstarter Project featuring the Falkaaran Adventurers from the Freeblades fantasy miniatures game.  This exciting project is focused on rapidly expanding DGS Games extraordinary line of 32mm fantasy miniatures.  This project’s main objective is to create and produce 5 new fantasy miniatures for use in our tabletop skirmish game Freeblades.  Your backing will take these 5 miniatures from artistic concept to masterful sculptures to production molds from which are spun countless freebands of highly detailed Falkaaran figures for customers to purchase.
[Visit the Updates link above to see all the latest info on this project - or scroll to the bottom of this page...]
The 5 Falkaaran miniatures we seek your support to produce are the: Jendal Bladeseeker, Karadal Bladesister, Knight Defender, Pikeman and Sailor.
Jendal Bladeseeker
The bladegrounds of Jendal produce some of Faelon’s finest and most dangerous swordsmen.  Before a bladeseeker can advance to the venerated rank of Blademaster he must complete a bladequest.  Bladequests are multi-faceted journeys of personal trial and growth, but are also designed to return experience and lessons back to the bladeschools.  Jendal bladesworn, with their rugged armor and vicious kolekars, often find service as a freeband leader the perfect vehicle to carry them on their bladequests.
Bladeseeker Sculpt
Karadal Bladesister
Karadal is charged with shielding Falkaar’s most open border, and the barony’s warriors serve on the front line of the kingdom’s defense.The Karadal bladeschool teaches one of the most direct fighting styles, concerned with striking the killing blow quickly and without wasted motion.The bladesworn of Karadal are cynical about the role of others, feeling they bear the burden of constant border clashes while others only talk of practice floors and mock combat.
Bladesister Sculpt
Knight Defender
Each of Falkaar’s Dukes and Barons keeps a cadre of knights in their service.The Knight Defenders are the guardians of the Royal Gate in Baramar and attend the King and Crown Prince directly.Some are sent on detached duty to study foreign armies or the fighting ways of the Tribes.They are highly sought after as freeblades for their skill at arms and ability to stand like a castle tower in a fight.
Knight Defender Sculpt
Pikeman
Pike-wielding soldiers form the resolute bedrock of Falkaar’s armies.  Many of Falkaar’s young men learned the way of war marching and drilling for their Duke.  Mustered out of their liege’s army, many seek work as freeblades, putting their martial skills to good use.
Pikeman Sculpt
Sailor
Falkaar is both a maritime and a mercantile nation.Cogs and caravels, cruisers and cargo ships alike need able bodied men and women to serve aboard.Many in Falkaar respond to the call of the sea, even those who are not raised in sight of it.Often the adventures on which freebands find themselves take place off the coast, up rivers or among the islands.Sailors make the perfect addition to a Falkaaran freeband, especially one with a penchant for nautical work.
Sailor Sculpt
DGS has the pleasure of working with some of the best artistic and sculpting talent in the gaming industry including Gael Goumon, Patrick Keith, and Chris Jackson.  We collaborate with this top caliber talent to bring highly detailed and amazing miniatures to market.  We do not shrink from the cost of top talent because we know it makes for the best products for our customers.  By backing our project you will enable us to continue partnering with this talent to make the best products for which a gamer could ask.
All our miniatures are 32mm scale and cast of white metal (lead-free) alloy.  This material creates a high quality durable miniature with exceptional texture and surface for painting brilliant works of art.  Each figure is sold unpainted.
A word on scale.Our 32mm models are designed to match favorably with what has become known as “28mm heroic scale.”Heroic scale models are not just taller than 28mm, they are also aggressively proportioned with large hands, heads, muscles and weapons.Our models are typically as tall as current “28mm” models, but reflect typical anatomical proportions.Our models compare in scale with those by Reaper and other top manufacturers and are superbly sculpted to allow strong character identification and a fun and rewarding painting surface. Whether used with DGS’s games, in role-playing or any other miniatures experience, our figures will enhance your gaming success.
This photo shows one of our models in comparison to a Reaper Miniatures model.
Scale Comparison. DGS on left, Reaper on right.
In our exciting and dangerous World of Faelon seventeen glorious factions exist.  Each faction comes to life through our Freeblades rules and miniatures. DGS released the Freeblades rulebook and miniatures for four factions in 2012 and the fifth in early 2013.  All of these miniatures can be seen on our website.  With Freeblades and our miniatures so well received by gamers, we have decided to accelerate our plans to make and release our sixth faction - the Falkaaran Adventurers.  Your backing will allow DGS to expand our product line and greatly increase the speed to market of the Falkaaran Adventurers for our customer’s enjoyment.
Add-Ons
Mass the Forces!
Add any Freeblades starter set (Black Rose, Grular, Falkaaran, Haradelan, Trilian or Urdaggar) to any reward...increase your backing by $25 above any reward already selected. Miniatures supplied unpainted.
If you pledge at the $60 or $100 levels, you may make the second starter set Falkaarans also. One can never have too many!
Pick and Choose!
Add any number of single Freeblades human-sized foot models to any reward...increase your backing by $5 for each model above any reward already selected. You'll have a chance to tell us exactly what models you want when the project concludes.
Creature Pack!
Add a Creature Pack (Golat, Grush, Vekul, 4 Plakhra, and 1 Alpha Plakhra) to any reward...increase your backing by $70 above any reward already selected.  A Creature Pack provides the models to play both the Beast Hunt and Demon Infestation Scenarios from the core rulebook.Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Demon Infestation Pack!
Add a Demon Infestation Pack (4 Plakhra, and 1 Alpha Plakhra) to any reward...increase your backing by $25 above any reward already selected.  This add-on provides the models to play the Demon Infestation Scenario from the core rulebook.Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Get the dice to play the game!
Add a Tiered Dice set (d4 d6, d8, d10, d12, d14, d16, d20, d24, d30) to any reward...increase your backing by $15 above any reward already selected!
Add a Freeblades Tokens set to any reward...increase your backing by $25 above any reward already selected.This set contains markers useful as reminders for a host of game effects and functions:
3 Objective Markers (black)
9 Loot Markers (black)
9 Life Point Markers (red)
15 Power Point Markers (blue)
4 Fate Stones (green)
2 Destiny Stones (green)
4 Charge Arrows (red)
3 Panic Arrows (red)
1 Delay Marker (black)
Add a Freeblades Rulebook to any reward level for $25.
Add the art of Faelon to any backer reward level $30 and up.  For every $10 added, you may select one 8.5x11 illustration from the rulebook.  Illustrations are printed in high def color on high quality paper.
Contacting Us:
We have so much excitement and great gaming to share.  Post your questions here.  Join us on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and our own website – www.dgsgames.com. 
Facebook- www.facebook.com/DGSGames
Linked In - http://www.linkedin.com/company/dgs-games-llc?trk=copro_tab

The risks to completion are very low. We successfully completed a similar Kickstarter, our first, last summer. Everything was completed and delivered on time. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project has some element of risk. We have done everything in our power to minimize this risk, and we've used what we learned last time to reduce that even further. During our first project we experienced a delay of three days and this time we've done everything possible to eliminated that possibility.

 There are four phases to this project and each has its own risks and challenges.

 The first phase was to come up with the concepts. The challenge is to come up with a miniature that has an old school look but still has a unique style all its own. This has already been completed and you can see for yourself the concept brought to life.

 The second phase of this project is to have the miniatures sculpted. The challenge here is to get the miniatures sculpted by the right artists. All the miniatures for the basic pledge levels have already been sculpted so there is no risk associated with this phase of the project. The stretch goals however have not been sculpted and it is always possible that there will be delays in the sculpting process. If this happens please be patient with us as we will get these miniatures sculpted and out to you.

 After the second phase is complete we move into the production phase. This phase consists of having master molds and then production molds made. I have this all done by a well respected company who is very good at sticking to deadlines. The challenge hear is to get the items into my hands in time. This risk is mitigated by having a professional third party handle molding and production.

 The last phase is the shipment phase. While this is not complex it really just boils down to me packing up all your orders in a timely manner and shipping them to you (with a tracking number). I have been running a small miniature company for about a year and a half. I have experience having miniatures sculpted, produced, and shipped out to buyers.

 With Stretch goals this entire process has to be repeated from the beginning. For this Kickstarter this is where the possibility of delays must be highlighted. The stretch goal miniatures are just in the concept phase right now and no sculpting has begun so there is a possibility that there could be delays at this point. I have learned a lot from my previous Kickstarter campaign in which I just recently had to find a new sculptor because of delays with the sculptor I was using. This is a very hard decision to make as it delays the delivery of stretch goals but it is one I am willing to make if it comes down to it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to the WarGods Kickstarter!
We're now have less than 3 hours of the program remaining. We wanted to make it simple to get involved... so we've made some easy-to-read graphics for the reward levels, showing all the minis and extra 'freebies' that have been added so far.
To get started playing WarGods, any of the following rewards will have what you need: Skirmish, Warband, and Warband - Miniatures Only.  They all get you the Kickstarter-exclusive 'freebie' miniatures like the Titan Hunter, Oracle of Delphi, and Helen of Troy. And with the freebies included, these deals offer a savings of over 25% of the retail cost of the package! If you are an International backer, the Warband - Miniatures Only reward is a great value, as it has a lower shipping cost, but you still get a PDF to play the game!
Thanks for stopping by and for all of your support!
--Chris & Debs FitzPatrick
A little lower we have graphics for all of the rest of the reward levels, but please check these out first:
What's the deal with the Stretch Goal Map?
This is a fun way to show off the stretch goals that we have planned. We've already achieved our basic goal of $25,000 - now we are expanding our goals, to unlock more options to purchase, add 'Freebie' miniatures to some selected reward levels, and make the book even better!  The little Croc Logo represents our progress in the program; we start in Sparta and we follow the dotted line across Olympus. When we get to each new funding level, the stretch goal for that location is achieved!
25,000 - ACHIEVED!: The WarGods book, 8 Demigods, and Trojans have been funded!  THANK YOU!
Those pesky Trojans have abducted the beautiful Helen from her home in Sparta! Your Demigod has been called upon to travel to Troy, defeat the Trojans, and return with Helen! Along the way you will gather additional allies to help in your quest, and face dangerous enemies that will attempt to stop you. Can you save Helen from the Trojans?  
$35,000 - Amazons - UNLOCKED! 
Only 2 days march from Sparta, a war party of Amazons ambushes your warband.  The battle is furious, but your forces finally gain the upper hand. The Amazons flee northward, swearing revenge! And now, on to Mycenae...
$40,000 - PDF Power! - UNLOCKED! 
$45,000 - Titan Hunter - UNLOCKED! 
Your warband arrives at the citadel of Mycenae, a fortress high in the rugged mountains. A mighty Titan Hunter pledges himself to your quest! He will journey with you and protect the warband from any monsters you encounter!  And now, on to Corinth...
Prototype Titan Hunter painted by Debs FitzPatrick, all miniatures provided unpainted
$55,000 - Corinthians - UNLOCKED! 
Your warband arrives in the luxurious city of Corinth, with glittering temples and winged horse circling in the sky high overhead.  The Corinthians promise to aid your quest, and you turn northward to Delphi, to see the Oracle and ask the gods for guidance on your quest...
$60,000 - Dionysus - UNLOCKED! 
"On your way to Delphi, your warband comes across a temple of Dionysus, the god of wine. A festival is underway, with drinking and merriment, dancing satyrs, and a jovial son of Dionysus leading the festivities. After an evening of wine and revelry, you awaken with a huge hangover, but the boisterous Demigod has joined your alliance!  You proceed on to Delphi..."
$65,000 - Oracle - UNLOCKED! 
At last your warband arrives at Delphi, and you ask the Oracle what is needed to defeat your enemies.  Her answer is mysterious: "Only with arms of bronze and fiery hearts can you defeat the stallion-breaking sons of Troy.  Yet with either victory or defeat, the journey home will take you through lands from whence no mortal has ever returned." You leave, wondering at the meaning of her words, and proceed south to Athens to gather more allies...
$70,000 - PDF Power 2! - UNLOCKED! 
$75,000 - Athenians - UNLOCKED!
At last, you come to the city of Athens, with olive groves and temples of white marble. As you pass through the streets of the city, you encounter wise philosophers and eccentric scholars debating the nature of the elements in the streets. Theseus, the King of Athens promises to aid your quest, and your troops board the ships of his mighty navy and sail north to Troy!
$80,000 - Reinforcements - UNLOCKED
Your fleet of ships stops for supplies and fresh water, and local warriors armed with javelins join the army! The mighty force of a thousand ships sails on toward Troy!
$85,000 - PDF Power 3 - UNLOCKED
$90,000 - Automatons - UNLOCKED
You arrive on a rocky island where the sound of hammers on metal is heard coming from within a cave. Inside is a son of Hephaestus, working on a mechanical bronze man, a golden clockwork owl sits upon his shoulder.  The Owl speaks: "Strong bronze arms powered by furnace hearts would make mighty allies," and winks at you. Suddenly the words of the Oracle are recalled, and you implore the son of Hephaestus to join your warband... he agrees, for a price yet to be named. You head back to the ships, accompanied by the limping Demigod and his clanking bronze menagerie!
Automatons estimated delivery - October 2013
$100,000 - Gates of Troy - UNLOCKED
At last, your ships land on the beaches before Troy, and the defenders ride out to meet your forces in battle. Leading them is Man-Killing Hector, their greatest warrior, and his brother, the magnificent Paris.  Swift chariots carry their heroes into combat, and archers darken the skies with Trojan arrows. The battle is cruel and bloody, but at last, you push them back to the city walls... the long siege has begun!
$110,000 - Mycenaean Chariot - UNLOCKED
A wave of Mycenaean chariots thunders across the battlefield and crashes into the waiting Trojan lines. Strong Mycenaean heroes clad head-to-toe in shining bronze armor strike out against their foes, nearly invulnerable to their attacks. The battle begins to turn against the Trojans...
$115,000 - Amazons' Attack - UNLOCKED
The Amazons, the allies of the Trojans, arrive in a surprise attack!  They charge into battle on the backs of galloping horses lead by Queen Penthesilea, the Daughter of Ares himself.  Their arrows find targets in the men of your Phalanx, who can't close with the swift enemy - only your archers can keep them at bay, and these men pay a terrible price, with dozens dead.  Finally, the Queen savagely charges into your lines, killing one hero after another, until she is finally brought down at last by your greatest hero.  As she falls and dies, he helmet slips off of her head revealing her beautiful face; all who see he are filled with regret at her death, even though she was their enemy.  Now, only the great city walls of built by the sea-god Poseidon himself stand the way of your prize... Helen of Troy!
$125,000 - Fall of Troy - UNLOCKED
The walls of the city of Troy are said to have been built by Poseidon, and invulnerable to the force of men.You call forth the limping son of Hephaestus from the rear of your army. He advances forward, accompanied by a towering colossus of bronze with the head of a bull. Three times the Automaton strikes the gates of Troy, and with the third blow the gates shatter.  Your army surges forward into the city, and the battle wages throughout the day. By nightfall the defenders are either slain, fled, or captured, and the beautiful Helen is yours at last! At the victory feast, after drinking too much strong Trojan wine, you boast to your men: "Not even the mighty walls of Poseidon are stronger than than I!" A cold wind blows in from the wine-dark sea, filling your men with a sense of dread. On the morrow, you load your ships with loot and prisoners, and begin the long journey back to Sparta.
$130,000 - Hydra - UNLOCKED!
You set sail with a gentle wind on placid seas, and make good time for the first day. But as night falls, the wind changes, blowing you back, and forcing you to land your ships at a sheltered cove.  But up from the waters come the serpentine heads of a hydra, and a dozen of your men are plucked off the decks and devoured before the beast is driven away.  Above the noise of the wind and surf, a booming laughter can faintly be heard.
$135,000 - Harpies - UNLOCKED!
Seven more days at sea, and you land on an island with trees filled with lush fruit. Your men go ashore, and they are attacked by a flock of hideous shrieking women with black wings. Many brave men are killed before the creatures are shot down by the archers on your ships. The long journey home continues...
$140,000 - Cyclopes -UNLOCKED!
$145,000 - Reinforcements 2 -UNLOCKED!
NEXT: $150,000 - Olympian Upgrade
$155,000 - Medusa
$160,000 - Cretan Pirates
And beyond?:  Now that Troy is defeated, what's next? Let's see if we can make it home!
The WarGods of Olympus softcover rulebook will contain over 250 pages, lavishly illustrated throughout with color and black & white artwork by renowned artists Des Hanley and John Wigley.  The rulebook will include an extensive gallery of miniatures painted by some of the best talents in the game industry, and a stunning scenery gallery by Herb Gundt (aka H.G. Walls.) Also included are 2 full-color sheets of Command Counters. The rulebook contains the rules for 6 city-states (Sparta, Mycenae, Troy, Athens, Corinth, and the Amazons) and the Titans.  It also includes all the rules and powers to create 10 different Demigods.  WarGods uses 10-sided dice, available from all hobby and game stores. The rulebook is planned for release in July of 2014.
The Game World: WarGods of Olympus is the 3rd game in our expanding game world. The first was WarGods of Aegyptus, based on Aegyptian mythology, and the second was the Wendigo Warband Guide, based on the legends of lost Hyperborea. All of these games share the same basic rules and take place in the same world – they are designed to be played against each other! So, if you play a Spartan warband lead by a Demigod of Ares, you can fight against a Harbinger of Anubis to control the Aegyptian Underworld!
More than anything, WarGods was designed for gamers who enjoy creating a cool story when playing the game, not just winning. The rules reward real tactical play, not rule-breaking gimmicks and unstoppable heroes. The background is a fascinating mixture of real mythology and historical cultures with an innovative fantasy twist. If you've ever watched and enjoyed old adventure films with Greek heroes battling against stop-motion monsters, WarGods of Olympus is the game for you!
Gameplay Demo:
Thanks to the San Diego WarGods players: Narrator: Wade, Camera: Donovan, Spartans: Tony, Anubi: Joe, and thanks to Mike Biel for logo animation.
All of our miniatures are hand-crafted in lead-free pewter and provided with plastic slotted base. All miniatures are sold unpainted, unless the reward level description specifically states otherwise.The size of an average human warrior is around 30mm scale.  The Trojans, Spartans, and Mycenaeans all have a September 2013 ship date. Amazons are expected to ship in October 2013.
How to order miniatures:
On the right side of the page are our reward levels. Simply select the reward that has the assortment of miniatures that is right for you, and pledge to that level. At the end of the program, we’ll send you a survey where you'll be able to tell us what faction you want, as well as some specific requests like shield options, etc.
All 6 factions have now been unlocked: Spartans, Mycenaeans, and Trojans (all shipping in September) Amazons (shipping October), Corinthians and Athenians (shipping July 2014). Each of these factions has the following packs of miniatures available in the reward options:
Warband Starter Set: a box set containing 1 Phalanx of 12 spearmen, 1 Herald with standard, 1 Musician, 2 Honor Guards, and a king (Amazons get Penthesilea, Trojans receive Aeneas, Spartans receive Tychedes, and Mycenaeans receive Agamemnon.) 
Phalanx: 12 warriors armed with spears and shields. The miniatures of this unit are posed with a front rank, middle rank, and rear rank, with the spears of each rank held at a slightly higher angle.  This ensures that the models don't bump into each other when placed in formation, and creates a cool cascading 'wave' effect when viewed as a complete unit.
Swordsmen: 10 warriors armed with swords and shields.
Archers: 10 miniatures - 9 Archers armed with bows and a Captain.
Peltasts: 10 miniatures - 9 Skirmishers armed with swords, javelins, and small shields, and a Captain.
Hero: with Armor Rack (a small extra miniature that can be used as scenery or as a game objective.)
Captain: with Casualty (a small extra miniature that can be used as scenery or as a game objective.)
Each unit will contain a number of different poses, usually 3 or 4, but sometimes more for the Phalanxes.  We like our units to have lots of variation! 
The Demigod is the leader of your warband. Each Demigod has a selection of 10 different powers -- for example, Hades can command the dead and summon a monstrous 3-headed hound to protect him, Poseidon can control the creatures of the deep and cause the earth to shake and stun his enemies, Hecate can call upon dark magics and the powers of the night, and so on.  Choose the Demigod you like best to command your warband.
Each Demigod miniature is supplied with a 25mm square plastic base, and is about 35mm tall (on average.)  We've designed them to be just a little taller than 'mortals', to help convey their supernatural power!  The Demigod miniatures are available individually or as a complete set, so choose the reward level that works best for you.  At the end of the program we'll send out a survey where you can specify which miniatures you want.
All of the Demigod miniatures were sculpted by Chris FitzPatrick, based on concept art by Des Hanley. Actual sculptures may vary from concept art; we'll update the images as the sculptures are completed. Click on the images below to see larger versions!
The Amazons have been unlocked! Amazons are available in the same troop options listed under the Trojans below.  All Amazon rewards have an estimated delivery date of October 2013.
The Amazons are the legendary women warriors of northern Hellas. They are allies to the Trojans, and bitter enemies of the most other city-states. Miniature battle games require a huge amount of effort to get right. They need great rules and an exciting background, professional artwork, and dynamic, well-sculpted miniatures. Crocodile Games has been hard at work on this project for a long time. We reached all our stretch goals and are fully funded!
Thanks to your backings Dark Dungeons: The Movie! will now go from being an idea to being a reality. 
For future updates on Dark Dungeons: The Movie! please check out the website (which will be up and running soon);
www.darkdungeonsthemovie.com
Thanks again!
____________________________________________________
I won the lottery.  Not the jackpot, "just" a thousand bucks, and being a typical middle-class middle-manager a thousand dollars is nice, don't get me wrong, but it wasn't going to change my life.  So I decided to do something special with the money.  I decided I wanted to spend it to bring something that would last;  I would spend it to try and bring Jack Chick's epic 1984 graphic novel / tract to film.
I wrote Chick Publications explaining this to them and I'm super-excited to announce that I have obtained the video rights to make a movie based on Dark Dungeons.
Dark Dungeons: The Movie
If you're not familiar with Dark Dungeons you can read it in its entirety here;
DARK DUNGEONS:  THE COMIC
But all you really need to know is that it sets out to show what Jack Chick knows to be the truth behind role-playing.  It shows that;
*Playing RPGs can make you gain real life magic abilities
*If you gain a high enough level you will be invited to join a secret cult
* Gamers whose characters die are in danger of committing suicide. 
* That DM's are vile temptresses that are out to corrupt their players to the forces of evil. 
Given all those startling claims it's amazing that the crusade against RPG's has not been more successful!  In fact, the last movie to crusade against D&D was Tom Hank's 1982 classic, "Mazes and Monsters."
We are going change all that. I'm already investing all of my lottery winnings in this project but it's just not enough to get it filmed and that's where you come in. 
If the idea of seeing a movie where all the anti-RPG arguments above are made with every last drop of drama and conviction I can wring out them appeals to you, then I want you to invest today and make this movie a reality. 
Please check out the video above to see what we are capable of and remember that you are only charged if we meet our funding goal.  If the project does not receive it's complete funding you are charged ABSOLUTELY NOTHING! 
NEW REWARD:  Backers of every level will receive their name on the movie credits if they wish.  Size of that name depends upon level of backage.
______________________________________________________
UPDATE: I am thrilled to announce a partnership myself and Zombie Orpheus Entertainment (makers of The Gamers and Journey Quest)!!!
Our mission is to combine our powers to develop, produce, and distribute Dark Dungeons: The Movie!
Zombie Orpheus will be working through multiple versions of the script until we get the story that we know needs to be told and will be providing directing, filming, and acting talent as well!
Just think what ZOE can do with the Dark Dungeons story!
Please spread the word about this partnership, as I know that together with ZOE we can all make the movie that you want to see.
____________________________________________________
Update:
WE are funded! Dark Dungeons: The Movie! is now going to be made. I want to give a big thanks to all our backers out there who shared my dream to bring this to life.
But there is no resting on our laurels as it's time to announce some stretch goals:
Stretch Goal #1: $18,500 - the Necronomicon and Cthulhu mythos are all too real, according to Jack Chick's website, so if we reach our first stretch goal I will be glad to expose the Cthulhu threat in Dark Dungeons the Movie!
Stretch Goal #2: $21,000 - One of the most powerful ways to get across the powerful emotions that a serious drama like this raises is through song. I'd like to include a dream sequence where Debbie visualizes her internal struggle through verse:
(Debbie, in a sad, thoughtful singsong:)
"Is this God in my hand, or is it just a d4?
Oh can anyone tell me what I'm rolling for?
Are there traps and daggers, magic missiles galore?
No, this ain't God in my hand, it is just a d4."
(Ms Frost, cackling:)
"You have mastered the magic, you have mastered the spell,
You are ready to unleash the powers of hell!
You have God in your hand, and you have your d4."
Now I hope that you know what you're rolling for."
Stretch Goal # 3: $25,000 - Dark Dungeons the Movie! is a fictionalized account of the oh-so-very-real dangers of Role-playing but we would like to include a short documentary on the DVD about the fearless crusaders who have stood up to "Big Gaming" in the 1980s and find out why the crusade did not enjoy more success and where it stands today.
__________________________________
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am the best person to make this project work because I am the only person who CAN make this project work. There is no guarantee that Jack Chick will allow anyone else to make a movie based on his work in the future either. He might, but he might not. But I have the right to make a movie about Dark Dungeons right now and I have the ability to make this happen. The time is now. The place is here. The power is mine. 

The quality of the movie will probably be very similar to that of my introductory video; that's the best we can do with what we have. So please take a look at that to judge what type of movie we are capable of making. 

The fact is, we are going at this with an ultra-low budget and that makes things incredibly harder. When the million and one things go wrong I won’t be able to throw money at the problem but will have to improvise as best I can. I also will be making the plot fit the budget, rather than the other way around. This includes simple things like not setting any scenes at night (lighting can be expensive and time consuming), no large crowd scenes (more people mean more complexity means more money), and showing puppet demons fleeing Debbie instead of using CGI demons. 

But I feel that the epic story of a girl who wants to be Debbie instead of Elfstar deserves to see the light of video and will put all my time, energy, and love into making this film and will do everything it takes to get it done.

By popular demand, we're offering additional years as an add-on purchase. Simply pledge an additional $35 on top of your chosen backer level for each additional year you want. More details and examples down below the backer levels.
Stretch Goal #4 - Custom Campaign URLs - $50,000 - ACHIEVED
Part of the reforging is an overhaul to make things look better, so we think everyone would like to make their page URLs look nicer as well. Every campaign will get its own subdomain (ie. “mycampaign.obsidianportal.com”) and Ascendant campaigns can set up their own raw domain (ie. “mycampaign.com”).
There will be significant technical challenges with this stretch goal, both in making sure that old URLs do not break and also making sure that all your old links to characters, wiki pages, items, and so forth automatically redirect to your new custom campaign URL. We don’t want to underestimate the difficulty here, so as with our File Storage stretch goal, we’re shooting to complete this stretch goal after the main reforging process. Our target date for the custom URLs would be mid-October 2013.
Stretch Goal #3 - File Storage Locker - $35,000 - ACHIEVED!
We’ve always wanted to expand our image upload to include files of any type. Every campaign has files they need to share, like PDFs of your world’s history or MP3s of your campaign theme music. If we hit this stretch goal we can add a spot in every campaign to store and manage all your shared files, so it’s easier to keep all your campaign materials in one place.
Plus, if we can hit this stretch goal, we will be able to increase the storage size limits for both free and Ascendant campaigns. The free limit will climb to 250MB and the Ascendant limit will rise to 10GB. That should be plenty of space to share everything your group needs.
Note: For this and all future stretch goals, we are targeting a post-August release date. We will do our best to get as much completed as we can by August, but we want to be realistic and open about our timelines. For the file storage locker, we’re aiming for sometime in September.
Stretch Goal #2 - Names! Names! Names! - $20,000 - ACHIEVED!
Since the beginning, I've wanted a good, solid random name generator as part of the character creation and management. So many times I've been staring at my players, mouth hanging open, waiting for a name to come out. They had asked about an NPC I hadn't prepared, and I just needed a name. Here, let me explain:
So what are the particulars of the name generator?
A variety of different naming "genres". You'll be able to quickly switch between Elven-ish, Dwarven, guttural Ork (think lots of Ks and Xs), and so forth.
Fast! - It will be right there when you need it, ready to give you the name you need and keep your players in the game.
Integrated - Instead of just spitting a name at you, you'll be able to create a new barebones character on the fly with the name pre-generated. So, when your players ask about that random new NPC 3 months later, they will be tracked normally in Obsidian Portal, just like all your other characters.

Stretch Goal #1 - Reworking the Maps - $10,000 - ACHIEVED
The campaign maps have been one of our favorite features since the beginning, but just like everything else, they need some work to make them better! If we hit this goal, we will be able to make the following improvements:
Deeper zoom levels for Ascendant maps - 5 instead of the current 3
Higher resolution images - 4096x4096 pixels instead of the current 1024x1024
A library of map markers - Different colors and shapes. Imagine dropping crossed swords to mark a battle, a tower to mark a wizard's abode, and a cave for...a cave. That's the idea.
Better connection with the rest of your campaign - Add markers for specific characters and/or wiki pages, instead of only the general purpose markers we have now.
The maps are already fun. Now let's reforge them into something truly useful and awesome!
Obsidian Portal Reforged
Obsidian Portal is the award-winning online campaign management system for tabletop role-playing games. We want to revitalize the existing Obsidian Portal by increasing its functionality, adding new features, and cleaning up the design. We are taking the strong core that is Obsidian Portal, heating it up in the furnace, and reforming it into a sleeker and sharper tool. A better Obsidian Portal will make your life easier as a game master, which will make your game the best it can be. That’s what “reforging” is all about.
Improvements
To provide you with the best possible experience, we’ll revamp the most frequently used parts of the site and rework them so that they’re easier to use. We will be examining every page for ways to make them flow better, provide the information you need, and allow you to navigate and manage your campaign faster and easier. The redesign will add more features to enhance your gaming.
A perfect example of this is our plan to create a campaign dashboard that will put the most important details of your campaign right at your fingertips. The dashboard is just the first of many changes that will fundamentally enhance Obsidian Portal and make it a much better tool than it is today.
A very rough draft of the new dashboard
We’ll be supporting these functional changes by improving the overall design of the site. We’ll take our current site and give it a consistent look and feel that will make it more intuitive to use—not a button here and a link there, but a cohesive design strategy.
With more of your support, there’s even more we can do to make Obsidian Portal the most robust campaign management system. If we make our original goal, keep an eye out for stretch goals for additional improvements.
Back us now and get a year of premium Ascendant membership at a reduced price when you back at the Ascendant level.
Why Obsidian Portal?
It’s free to use and built from the ground up, for gamers by gamers. We host a huge community of tabletop RPG players who are all looking to get the most out of their tabletop gaming experience. You play your campaign and we help you manage it. It’s that simple.
With Obsidian Portal, you can manage your tabletop RPG campaign from any computer, anywhere. You can tell your story and get recognized for your innovation and creativity. Now help us take Obsidian Portal to the next level!
Benefits to Backers
A year of premium Ascendant membership (Hasted Ascendant level and above). Not a GM yourself? No worries, the Ascendant time can be gifted to your GM!
Cool backer-only souvenirs like campaign maps, custom map markers, profile badges, t-shirts, letterpress cards, and more
The opportunity to have a hand in the reforging process. All backers will receive developer updates along the way for an exclusive look at the design process. Plus, Tinkerer Ascendant level and above will be able to provide feedback during the design and beta testing.
A slicker, more useful, easier to navigate Obsidian Portal. A better Obsidian Portal will make your life easier as a game master and improve your game.

My Backstory
When I started Obsidian Portal in 2006, I knew I needed to set aside some real time and focus hard to make progress. To accomplish this, I quit playing video games altogether and told myself I wouldn't play again until the site launched. If you're a gamer like me, then you know how hard that is, and also how much time that can free up. I accomplished some amazing things in those first 9 months, and it's thanks to that dedication that Obsidian Portal is where it's at now.
Fast forward to now. Over the summer, I have the chance to focus on Obsidian Portal almost full time. Plus, I have a team of designers and programmers lined up to help out. So, in the spirit of what it took to launch, I'm once again swearing off video games and putting my nose to the grindstone. It will be a hot and sweaty summer, but by GenCon in August we will have some awesome progress to show for it!
You've seen what I can do by myself on nights and weekends. Now let me show you how awesome we can be with a real team working near full time!

Risks and challenges
There could be programming or design challenges that we have not anticipated, but considering that we have been running Obsidian Portal successfully for 7 years, it's doubtful that there will be any obstacles that are insurmountable. We may have to ratchet back our ambitions a little, but we have a long proven track record of under-promising and over-delivering when it comes to updates on Obsidian Portal.

Probably the biggest risk is missing the target deadline of August 2013. In that unlikely case, we will make sure to keep all backers up to date on our progress and update our timelines as things progress.
